Reviews.Title: “Cheap & cheerful”
Reviews.Author: sgtpeppersalcudia
Reviews.Content: At the end of the day you only get what you pay for. This is the 3rd time my family have stayed in this hotel & yes it does need a revamp & is a bit worn & tired but the staff are friendly & provide a good service. Clean towels everyday, rooms & beds made everyday. Yes I did see ants in the sink but I live in Spain & have ants in my kitchen cupboards so that didn't worry me as once they are in the walls they are hard to get rid of. I was disappointed that there was no breakfast, eventhough it was just toast & cereal it was a bonus, but there are many places to eat nearby. The location to Disney is ideal & for the amount of time spent in your room I find this hotel ideal, at a bargain price.

Reviews.Title: “Dirt And cocroaches”
Reviews.Author: paulocmoura
Reviews.Content: The hotel is good to just sleep but. There is a it of stores And restaurants near the hotel. It's unnacceptable a lot of cockroaches in the room. Also there is no coffee maker in the room. Internet only in the lobby. May consider the prices x cleaning, This is my last time in it.

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare Hotel - Stay Away”
Reviews.Author: S K
Reviews.Content: I checked in late Friday night with my wife and two kids. We came into town to get an early start the next day at Disney. We usually stay on International Drive, but decided to give this hotel a try because of its proximity to Disney. What a nightmare! The bedsheets had stains that looked like bodily fluids from the night before. I slept on a towel with my clothes on. The towel had dead mosquitos on them. They looked like the towels my mechanic uses at his shop. Disgusting! I have stayed at many 2 star hotels, but this one was the worst. We slept 6 hours and left as quickly as possible. Never again. I would not stay here if it was free. Stay away!

Reviews.Title: “Get wat you pay for + A little bit more”
Reviews.Author: Reanne W
Reviews.Content: I know they say u get wat u paid 4 but u dont pay for bugs or atleast i didnt think you did. The first nite we checked in for are 7nite stay we saw a bug.It looked like a smaller version of a beetle and thats just one of them.They got everywhwere,at first we thought it was the same bug until we saw 3types of different ones.In ths sink and around the door were these tiny little ones but they got everywhere.I went to the toilet one nite,went to wash my hands and there was about 10-15 of these ting little bugs in the sink,I got a plastic cup and washed them down the plug.Another morning i was sat on the end of my bed and i was looking at the microwave to see that there was a bug in that 2,i dont mean init as i opened the door and there it was,i mean it was in where the digital clock is.I tapped the front of it and the bug dissappered,but how did it get in there n where was it going?When we checked out we was sat in the lobby wating for are taxi ,the lady on reception was talking to a friend on the phone,all of a sudden we heard her say "there not BED BUG bites I know wat they look like as weve got them HERE AT THE HOTEL" not wat u really want to here after spending 7nites there.Luckily me and my sister didnt get bit by any of the bugs.I can say that the room was ok but defintly needs attention and we did get replacement towls and are beds were made properly wen we got back to are room with new soap and toilet roll.It needs a kettle in the room,which i thought u would of got seeming you get a fridge,microwave,ironing board+iron and a hair dryer.We grined n bared it as we did just want somewhere to sleep as we was out most the time to Disney Land. If you want somewhere cheap to stay and dont mind bugs then its an ok hotel but i know that next time we will definitly be spending more and checking reviews.

Reviews.Title: “You Paid What You get . ( NEW UPDATED Jan 21th 2012 )”
Reviews.Author: Benfit23
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel as part of a package through Hotwire. Web site with photos, etc. of this hotel looked pretty good, But...it's OK !! On the hotwire travel site their site print it ( free Continental breakfast ) NOT ANY MORE . Since Jan 02nd 2012 . The Hotel are ok, base on the location are very convenient , but the hotel had a bugs were I stay, due to many people check in all the time , you dont know what they bring in, I had bad experience during my stay, ( 5 nights ) the last two night I got bite by the bedbugs ! I been bite by the bedbugs before So..I can tell the redness on the arms & my Stomach area . Internet access are only way at the hotel Lobby, theirs is NO internet access in the room at all , so..you have bring ur laptop to the lobby !! The Hotel dont provide continental breakfast any more ! You have bring your own food or eating out since hotel had a sign saying Starting JAN 02nd 2012 they no longer provide any breakfast . Most of the review you read on the site are depend on the person base on their stays, AND depend what room you check in , they are many tourist check in some bring their bugs in too . Over all rating for me are : Bad experience . You pay what you get ! REMEMBER .

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel is Fine!!”
Reviews.Author: Paulnewquay
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel as we were looking for a budget hotel to use as a base while we explored, and that is exactly what we got. I was worried when i read some of the reviews on here, but i didn't experience any of the problems mentioned on here. There is a good size heated swimming pool with plenty of sunbeds and they provide towels to use at the pool. There are drinks vending machines outside the rooms and there are washer/dryers too. The gift shop is tiny but it does sell all the essentials and the guy in there is fantastic. They do advertise free wifi, but in reality, you have to be in the lobby and even then it doesn't work very well. The Hotel does provide free shuttle buses to Sea world, Universal/Islands of Adventure & to the Epcot Centre (transfer by Monorail at Epcot for the other Disney parks). The only issue i had with the transfers were that they were overcrowded. One day, the bus was so overcrowded that i would say it was very dangerous (approx 40 people standing in the centre isle). But it was free so cant complain! The Hotel used to provide a continental breakfast but this was stopped on the 1st of January 2012, so now you can only get coffee in the gift shop. There are plenty of other shops & restaurants around the hotel. The rooms were cleaned everyday and were nice and spacious. We had 2 double beds, a safe, ironing board & Iron. But we didn't have any kitchen equipment in our room like some others have mentioned. All in all, it is a budget hotel, so as long as your not expecting valet parking and Caviar then you'll be fine!

Reviews.Title: “An excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: Mat_N
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel as it was cheapest available. Having read some of the reviews I was not expecting much. When I received my room key and I entered the room I thought WOW. It had one double bed with a sofa and chair.It had a microwave,fridge,a safe and TV. The room was clean and free from any smells.The bathroom and vanity area were clean as well. The hotel provided a free basic breakfast of Coffee,Tea,Orange Juice,Toast and Corn Flakes. I am an early riser(6.30 to 7am) and so I had the breakfast area to myself but did get much busy later on.I found all staff to be very helpfull There are a few restaurants and fast food places within walking distance and a Walgreens not far away There is a shuttle bus to Epcot (you need to use Disney Transport to get to other parks) it leaves at 8.45am and about 1pm. The return is 8.45pm and 10.15pm from the Ticket and Transportation centre and 10.05pm from Epcot, You can also use Lynx buses 55 and then 56 to get to and from Disney Ticket and Transportation centre. If you are on a budget I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Problems.....what problems?”
Reviews.Author: karentoward
Reviews.Content: This is a budget hotel and does not claim to be anything else. We stayed for 2 weeks as part of a package and had a great time even though previous reviews had made me very nervous. Check in was smooth and quick, ok the staff did not have the cheesy american grin but were very efficient and helpful. I had e mailed in advance with some requests which I hoped they would consider. On arrival, our requests had been granted no problem ( Thanks Mansur!) The rooms ,you could argue were a little tired but I was not on holiday to look at the paintwork. The rooms however were spotless. They were cleaned every day, clean towels left and complimentary toiletries left. The room had 2 very comfortable double beds, a fridge, microwave,safe, iron and ironing board. A coffee machine would have been nice but I am just being picky! Coffee was always available at the shop in reception. at $1 a cup. I cannot really comment on breakfast as we never had it except for a cup of coffee before we headed out. It looked ok, very basic, coffee, toast and cereals only yet it was always busy so can`t be that bad! Facilities at the hotel were good. 3 washing machines and 3 tumble dryers if you needed them ( $2 per wash and $2.25 to dry), small games room for the kids and a shop ( the guy in the shop was lovely so friendly and helpful) The pool and pool area was excellent. Pool was heated and a reasonable size. Enough tables,chairs and sun loungers so there was no need to panic and clean towels provided for use at the pool only.The actual pool area was very quiet considering the close proxmity of the road and loved the idea of no alcohol in the pool area. It was open until 10pm daily. All the staff always seemed cheerful and always acknowledged us with a smile or good morning. Maybe its because we were always cheerful and polite towards them. Overall we as family only have good things to say about this hotel and would definitely return. Yes its budget hotel and get what you pay for however I do think some people want champagne on beer money and will always find fault. Don`t be put off by some of the reviews as in my opinion some of them are i feel are unfair. I can only speak of our experience which was great.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for therefore excellent”
Reviews.Author: TriciaBY
Reviews.Content: Bed extremely comfortable, staff very nice. Hotel/room were a bit tired/in need of an overhaul and breakfast is really boring and there were not enough tables/chairs but it was so cheap that it was excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Stay Here At Any Savings”
Reviews.Author: TulsaTraveler1954
Reviews.Content: Has to be the worst place I ever stayed. Booked for 4 nights, could not hardly make it through the first night, would rather have slept in the car. The carpets were nasty, the bathroom was dirty and nasty, nold was growing on the desk chair, saw 3 bugs, the furniture was worn out, dirty behind the bed. Dont walk - RUN no matter how much money you save. Booked through AARP senior travel and paid in advanced. We left not not knowing if we would get a refund or not, didn't matter,,,,,,,,get the picture? It was terrilble. AARP did give us a refund for nights not used. Bill / Tulsa, ok.

Reviews.Title: “Dump - Dump - Dump”
Reviews.Author: garywn2002
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel as part of a package through Hotwire. Web site with photos, etc. of this hotel looked pretty good. This is our 4th trip to Orlando in a row, and all other accomodations were top of the line, until we entered the Dark Zone. We thought we had entered a third world country. After travelling around the world its the only place I ever encountered that the vermin would have moved out of. Other reviews indicate a terrible odor We experienced the same and it was so bad we were nausiated. It cost us a one-night stay penalty to get out of it but it was well worth it. Bottom line - do yourself a favor: NEVER STAY at this flea bag of a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, but you get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: Ian_New
Reviews.Content: I stayed for a couple of nights in October 2011 prior to attending a conference at one of the Disney resorts. Having done a lot of budget US motel travel in the past, this motel is little different from any of the other sub $50-a-night places that you can stay in across the USA. My room was spacious and clean(ish), with TV, fridge, microwave and a/c. However, it was all pretty lived-in and tired in truth (and yes, as others have mentioned, the room did smell damp). The bathroom was clean but again old - towels and other laundry were acceptable. There is a light breakfast served every morning - cornflakes, toast and coffee - which is again ok but nothing special. Staff are helpful and generally friendly. People have mentioned bugs and other critters in previous reviews - I didn't get any bedbug bites, but I did have to evict a cockroach that I found crawling across a wall on the second night. So, on balance, yes, it's cheap if you're on a big budget but, when you balance it all up, unless you're ok with roughing it a bit, you might want to consider paying a few mpore dollars and going for something a little more up-market.

Reviews.Title: “Not fancy but nice”
Reviews.Author: Dedegatineau
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from Continental Plaza Hotel from a week's stay. We loved it, nothing fancy but nice. The rooms were not modern but cleaned. The continental breakfast was o.k.(toasts and cereals).The location of the Hotel is not too far from theme parks. We had a car but their is a shuttle for the Theme Parks. We had a very nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “BED BUG CITY!!!”
Reviews.Author: agwtennis
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a serious bed bug problem and they are not willing to take care of the issue. When it was brought to their attention the front desk people were very rude about the problem and the maintence man tried telling us they were "sugar ants" We were promised several different things just so we would not report them to the health department or write a review. We did not receive anything from them except an awful time. The staff was exteremly rude, rooms out dated and smelled! While we were at the front desk complaining about the bed bug problem another guest came in very angry becasue the house keeping lady stole his Rolex watch while he and his family went out to the pool!

Reviews.Title: “It was OK according to the price we paid.”
Reviews.Author: pazter
Reviews.Content: The hotel was OK. It was very cheap so we cant complain. Either way, we use all the services included and they were fine; breakfast included cereals, bread, milk, coffe, tea and orange juice. The shuttles were always on time, but the last shuttle to pick you up from the parks was at 22hs (too early). Smoking rooms had a funny smell. Finally, they charched us the "resort fee" as they charge it to ANYONE. Dont forget what this fee includes. I would go back there because of its low price. In the end i didnt spend much time in there, i was the whole day in Disney!

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT stay here even for cheap...better hotels right next door!”
Reviews.Author: Canuckr
Reviews.Content: I know this hotel is a great location and close to Disney but please....book one of the nicer hotels next door (The Best Western). If you stay here...it will be hit and miss. I booked this hotel online for dirt cheap...and that's what I got...dirt and the bugs that go alone with it! I stayed at a nice resort the week before and thought I remembered this one but it turns out...it was the hotel next door I should have reserved. Let's just say...when you stay in a hotel, the minute you walk in to your room you shouldn't feel like you need to check the sheets and look under the mattresses first before you bring your luggage in - but for this place I definitely did. And GLAD I did. The rooms are VERY outdated, smell terribly and don't even consider a room on the ground floor. There were ants swarming around the sink by the bathroom and on the space heater, there were crickets coming out from under the bed, and when I lifted the mattress (to initally check for bed bugs) I found several small cockroaches. And to top it all off, when I was talking to the night desk clerk about all the bugs in the room and that I would promptly be checking out, I felt something bite my ankles! I was trying to get the red ants off my feet and ended up with bites on both ankles and my toes. How grosse! In other words......SAVE YOUR MONEY AND STAY ELSEWHERE for the cleanliness and peace of mind of what is NOT crawling over you while you sleep!!!

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT BOOK ONLINE, HORRID CUSTOMER SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: motodiva
Reviews.Content: The hotel refused to match multiple lower rates I had found elsewhere, so I decided to cancel due to unhelpful reservation services and reserve a hotel I KNOW has superior customer service. If it is this hard to get something accomplished over the phone its obvious customer service is not a priority at this property and i will be too tired to deal with anything less than quality customer service upon my arrival. Please note, although I booked online directly through the company’s website, I have been informed that it was a third party transaction and they WILL NOT cancel my reservation without the confirmation number which i do not have, yet they can see my reservation in front of them. They have one person manning the front desk AND reservations and he refused to escalate my issue to the general manager who apparently doesn't remain at the property at 3:45PM on a weekday as he manages THREE OTHER PROPERTIES. So, beware making an online reservation with this property, you will have to jump through hoops to cancel. And you will want to cancel when you learn there are superior area hotels who match lower advertised rates.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and affordable hotel close to Disney World Parks”
Reviews.Author: mneuman8201
Reviews.Content: Check in went very smooth. I paid $25.00/night after a good deal I found on Hotels.com!!! The parking lot was clean, the location of the hotel was GREAT (right next to many restaraunts, souvenier shops, and within 5 minutes to the Disnet World Parks). When we got to our room, we were suprised to see they upgraded us to a room with a kitchenette. This included a two burner stove, a small microwave, and a mini-fridge. The room was very clean, and the decor was current (unlike the 80's look most cheaper hotels have). The pillows were very comfortable, but the bed was a little hard for my liking. Upon entering our room we checked for bed-bugs (God forbid!), and the mattresses were as clean as could be. The air conditioner worked great, the shower water was hot and had decent pressure, and they provided shampoo and mini bar soaps. There was also a hair-dryer mounted on the wall. My only complaint would be the continental breakfast. It WAS free, and we DID pay $25.00 per night, so I can't complain too much. They offered Frosted Flakes, and Wheat Bread (with a toaster) as our choices. There was coffee and the condiments that go with. We choose to eat elsewhere, as we wanted to be fueled up for our day long trip to Magic Kingdom.

Reviews.Title: “The time of my life in the best hotel room ever!”
Reviews.Author: Laurarice
Reviews.Content: I'm a single girl aged 28. I decided to get away from it all in the UK and travelled alone to Orlando, staying in this hotel for 10 nights. I had an amazing time! I had a fantastic room with a kitchenette paying only £15/night (booked through an English travel agent). The reception staff, housekeeping and ticket agents were the best! They made me feel very welcome and more to the point I felt safe. I left yesterday and wish I could have stayed longer! WELL WORTH the money and I will be staying there again as soon as I can get the time off work. (I'm hoping next month- it was that good!) If you're not happy with something, say so-they will sort it. Fantastic location wit restaurants, gift shops etc all within walking distance of the hotel (I did the whole thing on foot as I don't drive). The shuttle was rarely late and if you want to go home a bit earlier from the parks, ask for a taxi from Animal Kingdom which will cost about 12 dollars. (Tell driver to take the Sherbeth Road short cut) Breakfast is fine for a few pieces of toast and orange juice- if you want an all-you-can-eat buffet there's a Sizzler and Ponderosa across the road about 10mins away on foot. I was so happy with my stay I wrote the hotel manager a note saying thank you. I cannot wait to return!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Could have been worse.... but I don't know how”
Reviews.Author: Hoffmandeb7
Reviews.Content: I originally thought not too bad.... boy was I wrong. I had to keep the bathroom door closed at night, there were noises coming from the fan even when it wasn't on. The bedding was torn and my feet kept getting caught in the holes. I went down to get some ice and found I needed to return to the room to obtain a quarter... ice was not free. The pool was not user friendly... the bugs carried you away. If you want to watch tv... forget it. There were maybe six channels available... The best part was on the way home, I found a creepy crawly thing in my purse. It was sooo much fun going thru everything I had taken outside my home before entering with my belongings. Won't stay there again! Be warned, I needed the internet for my school work, you must go to the lobby it is not available in the rooms. The refrigerator froze everything. The microwave took 6 min. to reheat a slice of pizza...

Reviews.Title: “Nice budget hotel in convenient location, close to disney”
Reviews.Author: Emaya1983
Reviews.Content: stayed in this hotel from april 19 to april 25 - check in is at 3pm and check out is at 11am, our flight wasnt until 7pm so they let us late check out at 12pm, if you ask them they may allow you to put your luggage in their office behind the counter until you leave for the airport. shuttle service - i dont know what people complained about the free shuttle service being late all the time, we used the shuttle service 4 times going to disney park and 3 times coming back and only one time was it late (it was approx 30 minutes late). Its approx 10-15 minute drive to epcot. We're the last hotel it picks up from so thats nice, and picking us up we're the first hotel drop off so that's great too. Bus going to magic kingdom comes to hotel at 8am, pick up 8:45pm and 10:15pm; to epcot at 12:50pm, pick up 10:05pm; sea world 9:20pm, i dont remember pick up time. One time we missed the shuttle and had to pay over $30 for taxi from magic kingdom to hotel so the free shuttle is a very nice complimentary offer for the hotel. Breakfast is served from 6:30 to 9:30am and its complimentary - its nothing wow but it gets you through the day. Its in the lobby and it consists of orange juice, milk, tea, coffee, little packs of jam, toast and corn flakes. There is microwave and toaster in the lobby you can use. Our room had two double beds, phone, we ordered playpen for our 1 year old, we put the 2 beds together to make one huge bed for us and our 3 year old, tv with 26 channels, drawers, table, chairs, safe (extra charge), hair dryer, iron,. We got lucky and got the room with microwave, stove, and fridge/sink. We used the microwave to warm up left over pizza for late night snacks, the fridge was good to keep drinks cold. There is an elevator, swimming pool and free internet in the lobby. Internet was pretty good we were able to check our emails and upload pictures to facebook with no probs. Reception is really friendly and kind. location is the BEST - is walking distance to lots of fast food and restaurant. right outside the hotel is Golden China, its a buffet, due to the high number of bad reviews for this restaurant we didnt even try it. Across the street is Giordano's pizza (you can get $25 gift certificates for $2-$5; and $10 gift certificates for $1-$2.50 from restaurant.com). Walking distance to Walgreens, market grocery place, dennys, wendys, macdonalds, indian cuisine, LOTS of souvenir stores, they all have the same thing at the same price but its nice to look around. Cici pizza is right outside the hotel, its the best, i really liked it, its $5.99/adult and theres coupons inside the continental plaza hotel that gives you one adult 1/2 price with 2nd paying adult plus 2 drinks, so for 2 adults $11.54 all you can eat pizza, salad, dessert, soup, pasta. They had 2 types of soup, 1 type of pasta, they had 8-10 different types of pizza (veggie, cheese, meat, pepperoni, mac$cheese, alfredo, ground beef, chicken, etc). Salad and dessert (apple crisp, banana cream pie, or brownies) - very delicious very good, You can also order 3 medium pizzas for $9.99. Which was perfect because we would order these pizzas and take one of the boxes to Disneyworld and eat it there for lunch/snacks. I would stay at this hotel again, its very clean, the cleaning lady is very friendly, reception is nice, hotel location is great, and its very affordable and nice good budget hotel. Nothing fancy but great if you're going to disneyworld.

Reviews.Title: “ok”
Reviews.Author: theonlyone
Reviews.Content: 3 times to this 2 star hotel,it meet my needs but metro shuttle service should be terminated,they were 1.5 hours late and desk could not get a hold of them.breakfast was not much but ok for on the run.my room next to office so had good internet.only paid about 30.00 per night so very low cost.pool was clean on this trip.close to shops and restraunts.so i will stay again .

Reviews.Title: “Great Economy motel”
Reviews.Author: barjil
Reviews.Content: I was worried about my stay at this motel after reading reviews. Once I arrived though I was more than happy with my choice of accomodations. I knew it was a budget hotel and was only expecting that. It was simple, great location. The shuttle service (free) was on time (give or take 10 mins) to the theme parks. Breakfast is only toast, 2 choices of cereal, jam, ornage juice & coffee. I was perfectly content with the selection. I 'm not a huge eater so I did'nt need a nasty greasy morning breakfast. The orange juiced was bad & watered down, but I only drank coffee which was good. I was unable to purchase base theme park tix at the hotel so I did so at the park itself. My room was 231 it was always clean, shower worked fine, lots of hot water, no bugs, everything worked. The room was supplied with a iron & board, soaps & shampoos, plenty of towels which were replenished every day. plastic cups, ice bucket. For me this was the perfect budget hotel with no perks. I would definietly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “No frills hotel near Disneyworld”
Reviews.Author: jk121255
Reviews.Content: We went to Orlando to visit Disneyworld so although I wasn't too impressed with the hotel itself, the extremely competitive rate and location of the Continental Plaza hotel is why I'd recommend it. -Quiet Pros: - The hotel was good value. The room was spacious and there were laundry amenities - Free breakfast. It's VERY simple, so basic cereals, toast, orange juice and tea and coffee. You can have as much as you like so it will get you through a day of theme-parking - It's really close to Disneyworld (10 minute trip). The hotel also offers a free shuttle to Disneyworld, Universal Studios and Sea World. The catch is you have to go at specific times - when we went, the shuttle departed for EPCOT at at 8.10am and there was a later shuttle at noon. To get back to the hotel, make sure that you get to the pick-up point on time. Shuttles depart Magic Kingdom at 7pm and 10.45pm. The shuttle can get pretty full as it does pick up guests from other hotels along the way and the Continental Plaza is one of the later stops. Being dropped home first is a big advantage though, and you don't have to waste time meandering around as the shuttle goes from hotel to hotel. If you get Giovanni as a driver, be sure to have a chat to him! He's a real character :) -Its located off the 192 and there's a grocery store and Walgreens for your everyday needs, a fruit stall (with AMAZING oranges), all you can eat buffets and fast food options within walking distance. I would not recommend the Golden China buffet on the same property as the hotel. -Guest Services in the lobby sells discounted tickets to a fair few of Orlando's attractions at a discounted price, and you can see back your used portion of your tickets to them. You can get tickets to most of the theme parks anywhere in Orlando really. Cons: -As soon as I entered the room, I was hit my a strange (and rather unpleasant) musty smell. I think it came from the air conditioner. We didn't use the air con throughout our stay and tried to air out our room as much as possible so towards the end of our stay, the smell was less overpowering. -The bed and the pillows were lumpy -I do not rate the maid service very highly. A few of my things were thrown away and I came back one time to see the bin bag on my things (probably left there by accident when the maid was changing the bin liner). Ew! - The shower is really hard to use and seems to be stuck on a needle setting. - The towels are pretty threadbare - The wifi only works in the lobby. But it is free. If you're flying to Orlando, make sure to check out the Mears Shuttle Service to and from the airport if you're looking to save some money by using a shared shuttle service.

Reviews.Title: “Attack of the ants !!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: garysweeney
Reviews.Content: We arrived at hotel at 1pm was told to come back at 3 because no rooms were available at that time. Our room had a musty smell, and when we woke the next morning there were ants on bathroom floor and on bathrooom walls. When we went to the front desk they told us it was because of us having sweets in room of which we had none. Maintenace came and sprayed floor and when we woke the next morning there were ants on nightstand, dresser, bathroom walls and shower. After 3 days they finally moved us to another room which smelled better, but woke up to find more ants in the bathroom we called the front desk again they blamed us on our sweets which we still had none and they came and sprayed walls, floors, shower and under and behind all furniture and finally on 4th day of our 7 day trip finally no ants . The breakfast is a joke of cold cereal and toast, no clock in room and staff is very unprofessional one of which was sleeping in back room and you had to bang on the side door to get him to come to the desk yawning and rubbing his eyes. I would definatly not stay here again.....

Reviews.Title: “Very clean but not very good.”
Reviews.Author: juiceman9998
Reviews.Content: Got a great deal off of expedia to stay here for 6 days. Room was okay, worn but very clean. Here is where my problem lies. There is no fridge in the room, there is no coffee in the room, the safe in the room doesn't work. No alarm clock in the room. I mean what hotel have you ever been to where there wasn't a clock? They even charge to get ice for your room, $0.25cents. Also when I went to the lobby to get quarters so I could have a cold drink he told me he didn't have any. It was truly unreal. But they do give you free wi-fi, so that's something. The pool is nice and clean. It is located on 192 which is close to everything which is nice but I would say to stay somewhere else, somewhere with basic amenities for the same budget price.

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your money”
Reviews.Author: Boid1
Reviews.Content: First, I need to say that I have actually stayed at this hotel in the past, and it was awesome. Either the owners have changed, or noone actually cares anymore about quality of service, but I can tell you, the place has turned for the worst. I do have to say that the room was kept as clean as possible, however we were shorted towels on three occasions. The beds were fine, the shower was hot, and other than that there is really nothing good to say about it. You will be charged $2.00 per day no matter how your package was booked for amenities you will probably never use. The "in-room safe" is an extra. There is no real "Continental Breakfast", unless you consider white bread, English muffins (not always there), one type of cereal, coffee and juice sufficient. On my past stay, I can say they put out an awesome spread including eggs, bacon, sausage, etc. I know that the times have changed, but not that much. The hotel as a whole needs refurbishment. The A/C unit worked only occasionally, the building is beaten and rusted on the walkways. Even the numerous Anoles which used to be present daily in the a.m. have abandoned this place. Since we really only used it for a bed, shower and a wake-up call I guess it served the general purpose.

Reviews.Title: “It does just what you need it to.”
Reviews.Author: Luckyman_24
Reviews.Content: In September 2010 my partner and I stayed at this hotel for the duration of the month and I can safely say it was the BEST holiday we've ever had, that would be due to the fact we'd always wanted to go to the states particularly Florida to visit the parks and live the American dream! The hotel didn't really play a part in making the holiday the best though, that was down to our days out, the food, and the experience we had in that amazing country. Regarding the hotel it is mediocre, there is nothing major to rant and rave about but there is no reason to have a toast to the hotels memory either. We spent 26 nights at the CPH and the first problem we had was with the fridge, the knob which was needed to adjust the temp was missing so we reported this to reception but nothing was done about it so we made do. Second problem was the cleaner, we had a name and contact details written on a napkin and the cleaner bizarrely saw fit to throw this away! Whether she was practising for the Orlando Magic I don't know but I left a note out questioning whether she had seen it or mistakenly thrown it away and later that evening when my girlfriend and I arrived back to the room this note had also vanished without a trace! Needless to say when we left we didn't leave a tip. Be warned, the hotel charges a standard fee of $2 a night so after being there for the month this was a considerable amount we had to hand over, this goes towards air conditioning, pool towels and the "free continental breakfast & internet", the latter three of which we didn't even use. Originally we had breakfast at the hotel only for a couple of days which was a basic cereal and toast but we decided to invest in some worthy fun cereals and snacks for our room so we wouldn't have to get up extra early each morning to eat before getting the free bus. This brings me on to my next warning, the free shuttle buses, these times were absolutely daft, the only pick up for Universal was 7.30am and then you have the pleasure of stopping off at all the other hotels for collections and then the pick up from Universal isn't until 19.30pm! It's not so bad at Universal because when the parks shut you have shops, bars and restaurants at CityWalk to keep you busy. As for SeaWorld this is the same shuttle as Universal so you arrive at SeaWorld before the park opens, and when the park closed at 6pm we had a nice 75 minute wait until we got picked up, that's if the bus was on time which it usually wasn't. Disney pick ups were slightly better, we had a 7.30am and 12.30pm pick up from the CPH and the collections from Disney were 17.45pm, 20.45pm and 22.15pm but when there are shows to see in the evening which masses of people go to, the shuttle times were very touch and go as to whether you would make it back in time to get the bus after having to battle through all the departing crowds! The irritating thing with getting the shuttle back to was each time we were the second from last to be dropped off so while you may get back to your strip in good time you have an additional 15 minutes waiting for drop offs. Sometimes driver's even stopped off uneccessarily because they didn't even check who was getting dropped off where. The hotel is in a good location, we ate somewhere different each night due to the vast choice of eateries. There are plenty of gift shops too for any souvenirs you may wish to take home. There are supermarkets nearby, across the road and up the road so if you do want to stock up on supplies you don't have far to go. For UK travellers like us, the roads are absolutely huge so be prepared for a walk each time you do want to go out for a nibble unless of course you have a car which we didn't. As for staff friendliness, it was nothing to write home about, a few grunts was the most you could expect and there was one particular occassion when we received a call from home and the message wasn't even passed on to us from reception! Our room on the recommended Third Floor was clean and tidy, free of bugs beside from the odd spider, it had a fridge/freezer, microwave, tv, ample sized drawers for all of our clothes and also a safe and an iron. There was a pool which was unsupervised which may not be good if you're travelling with children but it was a nice temperature and did the job if you wanted a quick dip to cool off. This is a good hotel to stay at if like us you are travelling on a budget and aren't too fussy, but if you are expecting five star treatment this isn't the place for you! The CPH will certainly suffice for a stay because sleeping was really the only time we spent at the hotel as we were out all day at the parks etc. Hopefully this helps, if you have any questions feel free to ask.

Reviews.Title: “Ok for the price”
Reviews.Author: grammajeri
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel since it was reasonably close to the Disney parks. In fact we were able to see the fireworks at night from our front door. The room was nothing outstanding. It was just a basic room. It was pretty easy to get around to good restaurants and stores. It was almost directly across the street from Outback Steakhouse. One block away from Golden Corral too. One block to Dennys and Walgreens. We were there for three nights. We flew in from California to go to one of the theme parks while waiting for time to board for a cruise from Port Canaveral. The room was comfortable enough. Nothing outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE!!! I REPEAT "STAYAWAY" !!!”
Reviews.Author: Wordsofwisdom_10
Reviews.Content: We reluctantly stayed here one night., it was supposed to be for 7 nights but I could not wait to get out of there. Believe me this is not a Hotel it is a Motel, the 2 1/2 Star rating is being generous it is not worthy of 1 star. The rooms smell damp, musty, dark dingey look shabby and dirty. I did not feel safe here at all. We booked through First Choice and they really should not be selling this place to customers. We are not fussy people and we are certaintly not as one reviewer put it "moany Americans" we are from the UK and we just have standards and I would never stay in a place like this in Britain so why would you put up with it on holiday. There are much better places to stay in the area, I would suggest the well known chains. The "free continental breakfast " looked a joke.

Reviews.Title: “would rather spend the extra money on a chain hotel.”
Reviews.Author: jgordano
Reviews.Content: had 6 rooms ( either the room and ants/broken tub) or was given the wrong size bed. Housekeeping ate some of our candy then left 1/2 eaten snickers in a napkin and came back to find all ants by the bathroom sink. Breakfast was a joke ( corn flakes, which were stale and toast). They charge you an extra 2.00/day for " pool towels and able to get park tickets there." Internet kept cutting out. It is close to parks and places to eat. That was the only good thing about it. Would rather spend the extra money to stay in a chain hotel next time

Reviews.Title: “Acceptable Cheap, close to Disney”
Reviews.Author: Sassix
Reviews.Content: The Continental Plaza is a mid size 2 level hotel that is close to the Park. We paid 22$CAN/night in Dec 2009, for 6 nights (one weekend). Booked thru Expedia. The rooms are plain, nothing special there. Carpet is dated, but the beds were clean and comfy. Pillows were awesome. We were able to get a ground floor room on the end where it was quieter without a problem. The pool was outdoors, and fenced in...not too much noise there. Seemed to be in good repair the one time I was in it. There is wi fi advertised with room rentals, but you will be forced to take your devices to the large lobby sitting area to use it. It doesn't reach the rooms, but they claim it does. We sat outside the lobby in our rental car when we needed to use the wi fi.. Continental breakfast available every morning till 9 in the lobby. All the usual: coffee tea juices, cereals, milk, bread/toast, u-make-them waffles, fruit. The Front desk Clerk frowned at me when I filled my reusable mug with coffee and pointed to the environment killing Styrofoam cups. Very strange. Shuttles to Disney 2x per day are free, but you need to sign up. There is laundry, but it looked pretty skanky. Its outside and there are no cameras. I didn't trust to leave my clothing while it was washing. Never did find the ice machine they claimed to have.... There is a Chinese food place right next door, but in the 6 days I was there, I was warned by hotel staff 3x not to go there due to food poisoning risk. There was enough pizza flyers shoved under our room doors that we didn't really care anyways. Reasonable food available with a short walk across Irlo Bronson Highway, or a short drive in either direction. Close to an open field with a man made lake in it. Kinda neat views in the morning with the fog. In summary, if you're like me and you run all day 6am to 11pm on vacations and just use the hotel to sleep, bathe and keep your clothes, this is a great deal. If you're looking for a cheapa place to spend a lot of time in the hotel pool and using wi fi for gaming and internet, this might be your best choice. Do be reminded, except for the pool, there are no luxuries here.

Reviews.Title: “Whinging Americans”
Reviews.Author: St_Helens_lancsTom
Reviews.Content: If you read all the reviews, then you will notice that 9 out of 10 of the bad remarks come from Americans, we europeans may have lower standards,but if you want somewhere cheap and clean, then this is the place. We stayed for 2 weeks, the rooms were cleaned every day, the pool area was spotless, the staff were extremely helpful, the only bad part was the car park not big enough

Reviews.Title: “one night only”
Reviews.Author: sunshinegirl0707
Reviews.Content: Dirty, Dirty and Dirty, I dont care how much you pay, dirt is not in the equation. Bathroom was filthy, the room was horrible. Needs a good health inspection. NEVER EVER AGAIN !!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, Cheap and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: TheBavers
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this motel with my partner in August 2010 for 5 nights. We booked this trough expedia and only paid £19 a night. We expected a nasty, dirty and old motel as we only want sokme were to sleep as we were going to be out at the parks all day. But when we arrived after a long 4 hour drive from Miami we were pleasently supprised. On arrival we checked in and they asked for $10 service charge for the 5 days. They said this was for the internet, pool towels and breakfast. We thought OK that sounds fair. When we got into the room we were very pleased. The room was clean, bright and large. The air-con was blowing ice cold and the towels looked like new. There was a large TV and a safe, when I checked the Wifi on my iPhone it showed full signal. We used the pool a number of times and again this was clean, large and in good order. The staff were friendly and helpfull. We had to pay 25 cent for ice but you can't have every thing. Our only negatives points were the breakfast was very poor. There was only coffee, juice, toast and cerial. That was it. We did not have breakfast here and went over the road where there was all u can eat at Sizzlers for $3.99. Also the room would benifited from a fridge as we could not keep our water and drinks cold. But these are our only minor points. Overall it was an excellent motel at an excellent price. If you want a cheap, comfortable and clean motel as a base to visit Disney and Universal this is first class. It was only a 5 minute drive from disney and a 20 minute drive from Universal. It is also close to lcal shops and there was a TGI, Outback Steak house just over the road. Highly recommened and a bargin at £19 a night. I would stay here again with out a thought.

Reviews.Title: “Cuoldn't get out of there fast enough”
Reviews.Author: HomeIsSchool
Reviews.Content: The positive reviews on Tripadvisor convinced me to stay at this hotel - so glad it was only for one night! I don't know where the other reviewers have been staying, but this was NOT up to US standards, even for a budget motel. Yes, the rate was good, but we've stayed in much nicer hotels in the area for the same rate. On the plus side, the mattresses on the beds were comfortable. It is located near the parks. The pool looked nice but some of the people lurking about made us wary - we parked our car in the light where we could see it from our room. The room had lots of little black ant-like bugs on the counters and walls. The air conditioner sounded like a jet engine every time it cut on and rattled endlessly as it ran - we finally turned it off until it was so stiflingly hot we had to relent and turn it back on. If you stay here bring earplugs. And wires were exposed underneath - really dangerous for small children! So we got little sleep in spite of the comfy mattresses. The room seemed fairly clean and smelled fine. Bedspreads covered damaged and torn comforters - another worrisome sign. The "continental breakfast" was a joke. We have never seen bread and cornflakes presented as a continental breakfast before - we breakfasted in the theme park instead. The internet connection was too slow to use, causing our son to question its security. And the toilet was the tiniest toilet I've ever seen in a hotel - like elementary school sized - really strange! This room was not worth even the low rate. We did not feel safe here and I would definitely not feel safe staying here alone. We couldn't get out of there fast enough!

Reviews.Title: “Don't expect the Hilton, but good value for money”
Reviews.Author: tornadosforecasted
Reviews.Content: Spent a week at this hotel while we visited the Orlando area and parks. I was a bit concerned given some of the comments from other reviewers, however given how much it was costing us (£20 a night) I was pleasantly surprised. There was plently of parking and the first room they put us in was clean and tidy, however a bit dark. So we asked to get moved and this was not a problem. Again the room was clean, even if the furnishings and fittings were a bit worn and the towels a bit thin, but again for the price we paid...... The breakfast was only coffee, OJ, cereal and toast, however this was adequate for us and our children. If we wanted more we would go to the Ponderosa just down the road. We were out of the room by 8am and not normally back until nightime, and this hotel was ideal for this kind of vacation. A free bus was provided to the parks but we just used our car. The hotel is situated aound 10 mins from disney world. Also the guys at the front desk were helpful, and the park tickets and advice given were of great help (for my wallet as well). All in all, this is the perfect hotel if you are intending to visit the parks every day and just have somewhere to rest your head at night. Don't expect anything luxurious, but it is good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “LOW STANDARDS - AVOID THIS HOTEL NO MATTER WHAT!”
Reviews.Author: SurferBoyQLD
Reviews.Content: Stayed at hotel in 2008. At that time they were trying to sell off the remaining rooms to investors. It was clear upon return in Oct 2009 that standards had slipped majorly. Breakfast was terrible, cleaning was very average. Our Room was damp and slimy. We checked out after 2 nights. I wouldnt even stay here if they offered free rooms!! Free internet is only in Lobby. AVOID THIS HOTEL!!!! Its not worth it!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the budget price”
Reviews.Author: jmiller9
Reviews.Content: Their "continental breakfast" was stale white bread and cornflakes. There were LOTS of bugs in the rooms including ticks and spiders. We found old, moldy juice bottles under our beds. Tenants were wandering the corridors and parking lot making noise at all hours of the night. I will say that the heated pool was very nice and the staff were pleasant, but I will never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Honestly...? A good, clean, budget motel..!,”
Reviews.Author: away_from_hear
Reviews.Content: You sometimes wonder what you have spent your hard earned cash on when you read some of these reviews!! However, rest at ease if you are travelling to this budget motel. Location is excellent, near Walgreens.. Outback and TGI's. The road leading out onto the back exit takes you to Disney in 5 minutes flat!! OK, so to the rooms. We requested a room on the 3rd floor. It had a microwave and fridge although no tea or coffee making facilities. Beds were comfortable with mattress protectors so no mites..!! A/C worked perfectly... and not so noisy either. The room overall was spotless, no marks on walls from suitcases etc, carpet clean, bathroom and shower curtain spotless!! Was I really paying less than $ 20 a night?!! The furniture, i.e tv unit and clothes drawers seemed to be the only thing that seemed a little tired, but not so much that you would notice. Our room also overlooked the pool, and was really quiet at all times. The pool too was a bonus, so warm, like getting into a bath!! Maintainance too was super quick. I needed some help with the in room safe and someone arrived seconds after I put down the phone. Rooms were cleaned everyday too with clean bedding/towels everyday if you required. The free breakfast was nothing to write home about, was good if you wanted to grab a coffee or OJ on your way to IHOP/DENNYS or the like. After all the debate before we arrived about how bad this place would be, turns out there was nothing to worry about. Clean and comfortable and have stayed in MUCH worse (if you have ever holidayed in Spain, Greece, France etc then this is the Hilton!!) so don't believe the negative hype and enjoy a modern day bargain!!

Reviews.Title: “What a fantastic little hotel :) A++++”
Reviews.Author: jadeaggy
Reviews.Content: Well folkes I do hope that my review will help put some of your minds at rest as i have been mortified by some of the comments made. I stayed at the hotel approx 15 years ago and had a fantastic trip, the trip was through Virgin Holidays so we expected a good quality hotel. When deciding to return to Florida there was no question as to where to stay. Unfortunately the bad reports about this hotel nearly put us totally off and we even approached the holiday company in the hope of changing to another location. Thankfully the other hotels were too expensive so we had to stay with the Continenial Plaza. On arrival the comments that we had read on here were going through our minds non stop... what if... what will we do.... are we going to have our holiday ruined???? over and over we were very concerned about what we woud face!!! Well on arrival to this hotel i noticed the perfect setting that i had been so pleased with before. We walked into the reception at approx 6pm - the polite helpfull receptionist checked us in and allocated us our room No 315 - it was on the top floor over looking the restaurant and with a view slight view of the pool. As we opened the door we were relieved to find that everything was in order, very clean and tidy... what more coud you ask for. It is hard to try and cover all the points that you may be worried about but i will do my best :). Room - very clean and tidy. Ants - NO ants were seen in or outside the room. Bed - depending on what type of bed you have, we found them to be perfect, not too hard, not too soft. Sheets - all perfectlly clean and changed when ever you put the sign on the bed - Our maid Annette cleaned and made our beds each morning, she is a very polite trustworthy and friendly lady who even picked up a few cents from the floor and putting them on the side, if we had left money/jewellery on the side it was never moved. Noise - NONE. Pool - cleaned each morning, nicely warmed, no noise, dosent get very busy ( some days we were the only 2 people using it ).Breakfast - well to be honest we ate out most mornings at the Golden Corral ($17.10inc tax for 2 all you can eat buffett!!) but we did have the free breakfast one morning - it was very busy and due to only a few tables we had to wait for a table but what more do you expect its a free breakfast so everyone will try to get it - there was toast, cereal and hot n cold drinks - nothing special but hey its breakfast and will get you started in the morning. We did notice that some people had bought peanut butter and choc spead to put on the toast which was allowed. A couple of mornigs i did actualy call in and pick up 2 glasses of orange juice to take back to the room - again no one minded. Hotel Location - PERFECT - you coudnt ask for a better located hotel you are down the end of the 192 so all you need to do is drive out to the main road turn right (no choice) and the do a u turn - drive down here for everything - all your restaurants (Black Angus is a must) Old town, shops and much much more - u can pick up the interstate 4 fom here and everythign for Disney/Universal/Nasa etx is sign posted along. Like i said before you get what you pay for and this hotel offers you excellent value for money. It was my 2nd visit and my Husbands 1st - he said without question if he ever returned to Florida he would check back in.... SAY NO MORE, PLEASE DONT BE PUT OFF BY THE OTHER COMMENTS.

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your money to stay there”
Reviews.Author: joanne_leung88
Reviews.Content: Very Dirty! All the towels have stains on them, some even have blood stain on it. Bedsheets were dirty. The Bathroom is the most disguesting area. Scum on the showerhead, bathtub, toilet etc. You walk on the carpet just feels so sticky.. About the location, compared to the other on celebrations area, seems not so close to those theme parks.

Reviews.Title: “DO YOURSELF A BIG FAVOR...DON'T STAY HERE”
Reviews.Author: nolemercy
Reviews.Content: Ok, so here goes, the cheap price lured us into staying here, we thought the location was great, but everything else was just horrible. First off, the bathroom lights didn’t work, the carpet was filthy(soles of your feet will turn black..guaranteed) the AC unit didn’t work well, and to top that off, hotel is infested with cockroaches. Please do yourself a favor, do not stay here. Im only posting this because I don’t want you to make the same mistake we did, don’t waste your hard earned money here, you couldn’t ask me to come back and stay for free, please beware!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location for all attractions and value for money!”
Reviews.Author: kerry2067
Reviews.Content: My partner and I recently stayed at this hotel. The location is fantastic plus they offer free shuttles to most of the attrations. We shuttle buses can get crowded so ensure you book your place with the receptionist. If you're considering hiring a car, it is 14dollars to park in the attractions for the day. Breakfast consists of cereal, toast, orange juice and coffee. There are many restaurants which serve breakfast within walking distance of the hotel. Staying in this hotel you are spoilt for choice for restaurants, gift shops, supermarkets and buying attraction tickets. Rooms are basic but then we didn't pay much to stay there. We were so busy that we didn't get chance to go to the pool, although whenever we walked past it was quiet. Overall a good hotel which is ideal for visiting the attractions and value for money!

Reviews.Title: “loved it”
Reviews.Author: Fairybell
Reviews.Content: have stayed here many times now, an never have we complained once about anything because the rooms were great this year we even had a 4 ring hob, microwave, fridge, the room was kept so clean , clean sheets when ever we wanted towels clean every day the supervisor spoke to us every day asked if we needed anything had a smile every day we were there, how can you moan about this hotel its perfect, close to all the food outlets walgreens opposite you can walk to all the shops, what is there to moan about, if you want 5 star then go and stay in 5 star pay 5 star money bet you will moan then? you dont buy the room you just stay there for a short while STOP moaning and enjoy your holiday its a GREAT hotel i will be going back again in 2011

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay- not as bad as other reviews make out”
Reviews.Author: omegaglas
Reviews.Content: I read a great many of the reviews of this motel before leaving the UK and wondered what had I booked! I also examined their website which includes very little information. Upon arriving at the motel I was asked to pay the resort fee which I knew about and indeed most of the motels charge this or charge you for the safe in your room which amounts to around the same thing. The room that we stayed in was on the third floor furthest away from the main 192 road. I asked for this because in the many trips that I have been to in the US before they seem to expect that you will want a ground floor which is usually noisier. The 192 roadway outside is not too noisy and certainly nothing like the noise levels at night that you would experience up at International Drive beside the I4. The room interior was recently decorated and in a style similar to most US motel rooms with two large queen sized beds, air conditioner mounted at the window and came with safe, refrigerator and microwave. Many other reviews suggest that rooms smell of damp, I did not experience this but it wouldn't surprise me as Florida has a sub tropical climate with very high levels of humidity. As to complaints other reviewers had regarding crawling insects, maybe this occurs on lower levels and yet again it is a sub tropical area with loads of insects. Overall it depends what you are looking for. If you are expecting a European style hotel you will be disappointed. The vast majority of the accommodation available in Orlando are motels and having stayed in many of them I would not say that this is the worst. My family were looking for somewhere to sleep at night and go to the theme parks, shopping and touring during the day and this motel suited us perfectly.

Reviews.Title: “A Value Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Stellastew
Reviews.Content: If you bear in mind it's a value 2* motel it's not bad. We had requested a king size bed but when we got there none were available. No problem, come back tomorrow and you can change room. The breakfast is plain cereal, toast coffee and juice but we wouldn't want more than that anyway. The place was clean, towels and sheets were changed. Ok so the furniture was a bit tired but stuff worked, plenty of hot water and there was a microwave and fridge in the room. It was a good location, plenty of restaurants nearby and easy access to major routes The heated swimming pool was lovely with fresh towels piled high.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best”
Reviews.Author: ThisGuy10
Reviews.Content: First off, I only booked this hotel because of the price. I used an online travel site to try and save some money. I got the room for about half the price, rather than pay night-to-night. The room definitely wasn't worth the advertised price (about $60/night) and I would be hard pressed to say it was worth the $32 I paid. First, the desk clerk was one of most dis-interested people I've ever seen. He has a lot to learn about customer service. Second, the room had only a fraction of the advertised "amenities" that were listed on the hotel's main website. No refrigerator, no microwave, no coffeemaker, no alarm clock, no data port/modem connection, no newspaper. They need to either furnish the rooms as described, or change the descriptions online. The "Cable TV" consisted of only 28 channels, including 4 Spanish networks, 2 "vacation" channels, and HBO that was too fuzzy to watch without getting a headache. The "Internet access" consisted of a shaky wireless signal in the lobby. The room had the typical hotel feel, same musty smell, same loud wall unit A/C as most cheapies. It was clean, but I didn't bring my blacklight so who knows? Third, the bed was awful. I can only describe it as turning a boat upside-down and trying to sleep on it. Thank god for Ambien. The employee-of-the-month mentioned above also forgot my wake-up call for Monday morning, luckily I set my cell-phone as a back-up. The continental breakfast was an absolute joke. 3 loaves of bread, 1 toaster, two tubs of no name cereal, 1 jug of room temp OJ and a pot of burned coffee. I ended up grabbing a sandwich at McD's instead. The only good thing I can say about this place is the location. It is literally 8 minutes from Disney. My conference was at one the Disney resorts and it was a very short commute. That being said, if your in town to anything Disney, there are plenty of other hotel's located on the same stretch of road. Glad to be home.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for 2 weeks”
Reviews.Author: 5onourway
Reviews.Content: We are a family of 5. I was quite nervous before our arrival at this hotel after reading some of these reviews. This hotel was a great value for our 2 week stay. The location was great. 5 minutes from Animal Kingdom gate using back road called Sherberth. Huge clean heated pool. We had a fridge and microwave which made the stay all the better. Never ate breakfast at the hotel because it was somewhat underwhelming so had breakfast in our room and we would drive to McDonalds to get our morning coffee. On-site laundry great feature for our stay. We were on the 3rd floor backside of hotel therefore no noise from above and very little walking by or from road. The staff were always friendly and helpful. Always had clean towels and linens. We would leave a tip for housekeeping because hey... someone else is cleaning up after my family so for this I am quite grateful! Walking distance to grocery, pharmacy, and restaurants. Very close to Super Target, Olive Garden, Publix you name it! Now for the negatives again keeping in mind we were able secure a great price for our stay so negatives are very few in our minds Wi-fi does not go much further than the lobby we already knew this from prior reviews and it really didn't matter. The rooms and hotel are a bit tired and in need of a reno. Keeping in mind that we did not travel to Florida for a hotel room. We simply needed a safe, clean place (our room was somewhat clean we helped it out a bit) to drop our stuff and lay our heads at night for 2 weeks. Everything we requested we were able to have. I did phone a couple of days prior to our arrival to secure the items that I had requested via our internet reservation. At that time I also requested a room on the third floor due to previous reviews on here. We would definitely stay here again for the money that we spent. Everything worked out really well for us.

Reviews.Title: “Great Bargain--but be prepared for some compromises....”
Reviews.Author: Toolman0701
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked this hotel, sight unseen, due to some great internet pricing. We were pleasantly surprised by the location and quality of the hotel. Like some other reviewers have stated, there are a couple of shortcomings...the "Continental Breakfast" is stale bread, lousy toasters, cereal, coffee and orange juice. The wireless internet--somewhat annoying to have to go to the lobby, since it doesn't reach to the rooms. Our ice machine was broken...beyond all that, though, we got a non-smoking room 2 miles from the Disney Main Gate for about $30 a night. The pool was clean, the room was clean, the staff was friendly...I can't ask for anything more, and certainly not for the small amount I paid. The MAJOR downside to this hotel, in fact, is that you have to make a u-turn slightly down the road to get to Disney....depending on traffic, THAT can be hazardous. All in all, though, we WILL consider coming back next time.

Reviews.Title: “nice and cheap”
Reviews.Author: elkridgeElgin
Reviews.Content: its close to everything if you drive to orlando this is the spot and make sure to get your park tickets next shopping center over from the hotel where the dragon is you cant miss it universal only 60.00 bucks a 30.00 savings, i love the 3rd night free and the pool is heated and feels great in may at night .

Reviews.Title: “KNOCK IT DOWN!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: sjlord
Reviews.Content: This is the worst hotel i have ever stayed in. We should have turned around when i went to check in and was told that we were not booked in to the hotel. We booked with first chioce and had booked in july 2009. After a 91/2 hour flight, and being up from 3am uk time (time we got to hotel 5.15pm us time) i was in no mood to be told that we didnt have a room. My mum is disabled and i had when booked requested a ground floor room s none of this was on their system. I called first choice and had to get them to speak to the rude and unhelpful man. Unfortunatly they had rooms available. The rooms smelled, the was mould in the bathroom, skirting boards were coming off, feceas in the toilet that had not been cleaned, ant type bugs in both rooms, security latch held on slightly by one screw not 3. Called first choice again and was told that there was no rep that came to that hotel but arranged for one to come at 11am the next morning. Had to wait around till 11.30 for rep to arrive who was a waste of time. All he wanted to do was to us to spend more money on transfering to another hotel. Had previously stopped at the cont. plaza on international drive in 2007 and itwas the same class hotel but was far better. isues were never resolved and tried to move us rooms but the were just the same. Now of what I think is the WORST - Whad 2 1/2 days of rain(which it can rain anywhere that was not the problem) when it rained it poured down the wall in the lobby/breakfast area right on to an electrial exit sign and the onto towels that they had put onto the floor!!UNACCEPTABLE!!!! We told the rep this and told him of the Health and Safety issue here and they still did not move us. Stay at your own risk, also while we were watching tv in the room (kids were asleep) smeone tried to open our door - we did not feel safe. I would never stay in this hotel again. We saved to come here for my sons 7th birthday and it was ruined!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location for good price”
Reviews.Author: Alabama_UsaAlamo
Reviews.Content: Very reasonable price, I enjoyed it. but few things - hotel needs to be remodeled, breakfast is poor, other than that staff friendly, good location, and clean rooms. We will come back again

Reviews.Title: “Good value, but would not stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: travelgirlnj86
Reviews.Content: The hotel stay cost about $100.00 to stay 4 nights through a promotion for free nights so I was impressed with the price! There was a very distinctive odor in the room, not sure if it was moldy or cleaning products or a mixture of both. In fact when I got back home even my clean clothes still had that smell on them! My papers and clothes also had a damp feeling to them. Bed was clean but there were small ants on the sink by the bathroom. We ended up changing rooms to a upper floor with a larger bed (we originally had 2 doubles). No ants, but still that same odor. Our tub had a cover over it and I was afraid to lift it up to see what was under it. Breakfast was disappointing but we usually just ate toast to get us going.

Reviews.Title: “Dismal”
Reviews.Author: john.smith76
Reviews.Content: Have been to this Hotel before but it has gone downhill. When we arrived we were met by a stoney faced receptionist ,($1.99) for room key(that is a first).On entering the room there is no facilities to make a drink ,so beware if you require a coffee you are out of luck,even if your own there are no coffee cups. By the way ice will cost you 25 cents,but the machine was not working. Do not bother with this place,at one time it was good value but not any more.

Reviews.Title: “The most awful hotel I,ve ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: AllFairness
Reviews.Content: We had the most terrible experience ever!! There is ants in the sink, crawling all over, when I complained, they said we can give you a "cleaner" room tomorrow. We gave them a second chance. When we came back after a long day in Disney's, we found more ants in the new room, that wa"sprayed" PLUS a toilet that was had dry feces on the seat. We definetely complained, but the counter staff gave us the choice of cleaning supplies to clean ourselves, because the cleaning staff is off at night time. That was outrageous!! We moved out after that incident, and did not get our money back for that night, as we did not comply to the policy on checking out prior to 11 am. It was just a disater!!, also Expedia did not help, we bought the package through them, and could not get a refund for the night we did stay. Never ever use them again!

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE (unless you like bugs) 11/2009”
Reviews.Author: dmasAKRON
Reviews.Content: I booked this motel because of the price - about $27 / night. I booked it for 4 nights. I arrived on 11/23/2009 about 9pm. I am a single Mom on a very tight budgt and do not expect 5 star paying only $27. But this palce was AWFUL!!! I was in the far part of the motel, third floor. "Free" high speed internet never worked. The outlets in the room did not work for anything other than their tv and lamps. Which means the cell phones, Nintendo DS, and laptops never charged. The hair dryer.... the ON button is on the wall, and you have to hold the button in the whole time. That was kinda weird. And the final thing that had me picking up the phone having a fit..... BUGS! I saw 2 bugs when we got in late the night before. I was not happy, but, bugs live in the world too, maybe a couple snuck in. By morning, the table between the 2 beds had about a hundred bugs on it. UNACCEPTABLE!!!! Free breakfast consisted of bread to toast (toaster was too small and bread stuck out the top) and sugar flakes. Milk. orange juice and coffee. I could handle that. It is only $27 / night and I would be eating the same thing at home. But everything else. Oh...... did I mentioned the yellow stain on the sheets? I left this hotel the next morning and went to the Holiday Inn Maingate. Sure the cost was more, but it was CLEAN, modern, free breakfast consisted of a large buffet, outlets worked, and I never saw one bug!! I ended up paying about an extra $100 total, but SO WORTH IT.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay - Couldn't expect more for the money!!”
Reviews.Author: klee_baker
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I stayed at this hotel.I booked vis expedia.co.uk and think it only cost about $20 per night due to the deal we got. We were checked in from the 17th November to the 28th, and had a great stay with only 2 minor glitches: Start with the 'bad': When we got there we went to the room and went to put things in the safe - the safe kept giving an error message so we went down to front desk & maintenance we sent up immediately. The man who came to the room checked it & said it was OK - the safe flashed 'lowbat' but allowed us to lock our belongings away. The next morning we woke up ready to go out, went to open the safe only for it to say 'error' and would not open. I thought I'd ring reception, then it turned out our phone was missing the wire!! Went back down to reception who again sent somone up. This time it took around 30 mins, but this person changed the battery connector on the safe & we had no problems with it at all for the rest of the stay!! So on to what I liked: We had a non smoking room with two double beds - this seemed standard at the hotel. There was a table with chairs, standard bathroom etc. The room was good quality - there were a few bits where the paper was peeling in the corners, but I wouldn't expect perfection! The maid service cleaned the room on a daily basis and we had no problems at all there - overall the room was just what I needed - somewhere to bath and sleep, with plenty of room for all my purchases! The hotel was close to lots of things on the 192 - and only a short drive to Disney (we had our own car so did not use the shuttles). Plenty of places in walking distance to eat at night! They offer free internet, but you need to use the lobby to pick up the wireless signal! This was OK though - it was free afterall The breakfast I can't really comment on as I was either out earlier, or prefered to pay for a buffet at a restaurant. I did go down one morning and it seemed busy (not surprising based on the number of guests). They had the usual toast / cereal / juice / coffee, but not much else! The pool again was clean and sufficient for my needs when I used it - the temperature was perfect! Overall I'd definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly Adequate Overnight Stay”
Reviews.Author: Deerstone Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: We have been to this complex a number of times. It has always been perfectly adequate and acceptable for our overnight needs. It is clean and reasonably comfortable, convenient for many eateries and supermarkets and for access to the interstate highway. It is good value for money although you have to pay a small amenities charge on top of your reservation cost. There is a very basic breakfast provided as part of the price - cereal, toast, coffee. The staff are pleasant and if there is a technical problem, maintenance arrives promptly. We were a little disappointed that the water did not seem as hot as in our previous visits, on our most recent visit - maybe we were just unlucky !

Reviews.Title: “This is a true BARGAIN. The breakfast & shuttle are FREE!”
Reviews.Author: nysq1
Reviews.Content: I read the other reviews, AND heard comments of fellow guests, but I had to keep reminding myself that the total package for 10 days and 9 nights was $420 including flight and hotel for 2 people. (Expedia) Considering the BEST price I could find for the flight alone was $135 each, that means the hotel cost was $150 for 9 nights. That's $16.66 / night! Now the breakfast was indeed basic but FREE. Toast, wheat & white, corn flakes - frosted or not, coffee. OJ & Water (yea - the OJ was pretty dilute). It was enough to sustain, and walking distance to $3.99 buffets is you wanted more. And yes, the shuttle had limited schedule, but it was at the times most folks would want to go. A cab ONE WAY was over $18.00 to Animal Kingdom, so we got up for the 7:55am shuttle! TIP the drivers. That's a tough job! Now the room was clean and well attended to every day. The water was hot. The A/C was cold, and all the light bulbs worked. The sheets were clean and the beds may have been a bit saggy where you sit on the edge, but I slept like a baby. Laying down, they were as comfortable as mine at home. TV had more than enough channels, and the Wi-Fi worked fine in our room. I didn't expect the breakfast to be cooked to order with an omelet station and a chef with a tall hat. I paid $16.66/day for a room in 2009, and got a free shuttle round trip to Disney (or Universal or Sea World), and a basic breakfast. Yes, I had to pay 25 cents for a bucket of ice. I'll bet lots of folks were filling up coolers when it was free. A quarter...no big deal...I just got a room for $16.66 / day in 2009!!! Oh, and the pool was clean as a whistle, with plenty of pool towels and nice warm water. I was very pleased with our stay. In summation, hard to beat this place for VALUE.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: taffydi
Reviews.Content: The check in staff were ok but did not advise us of breakfast that was done by the person on the trip desk, which is also timeshare sales. They offer some good prices that do not include a high pressure sales tour. I would prefer to pay full price than have to go to one of those. Rooms are clean but very basic, there is no fridge or microwave, which is very unusual even in a budget hotel. There is a safe in the room that it very easy to use and would hold a laptop easily. The pillows are actually cushions and not the most comfortable, I slept without any. There are a lot of little ants around and sometimes some bugs but it's a tropical area and this comes with the territory. We didn't use the pool so cannot comment but there always seemed to be people there having a good time. We cannot comment on the breakfast as we didn't bother. It appeared to be bread (toast) cereal, juice tea and coffee. We went to the Golden Corral most days $17.10 for 2 all you can eat buffett which is about 3mins away in a car. The hotel is ideally situated for both Disney approx 15mins, Sea World 20mins and Universal 25mins both by car, although the hotel does offer a shuttle service we did not partake. I would throughly recommend Kennedy Space Centre, we spent 2 days there and could have gone again. We paid extra and did the up close tour, which we both found very interesting as you get close to the shuttle launch pads and the NASA building for picture taking. You see a bit more than on the normal tour to Saturn V centre and the clean area. One ticket covers admission for 2days but you must remember to get the ticket stamped on your way out and return within 7days. I would also recommend the Arabian Nights dinner (good deal if you book through the services desk) 90mins of entertainment and a reasonable 3course meal, as much soft drinks and house beer as you like. The horses and riders are very good and at the end you get to meet the horses up close for pictures and a chat with the rider. My favourite theme park was Busch Gardens excellent even if you don't like the rides there is plenty to do. Sheikra, Montu and Rhino Rally are excellent my favourites. The train that goes around the park is a must do as is getting a birds eye view on the cable car. Then you can check out all the animals. The Meerkats are my favourite along with the Hippo and the tigers. In all fairness it is all excellent. The only drawback is that it is about 90mins from Kissimmee/Orlando but again transport is included if required. My favourite water park is Blizzard Beach, I have been to all in the Orlando/Kissimmee area and I think this one is the best by far. Don't miss the Dolphin and whale show at Sea World it's excellent.

Reviews.Title: “good value for money very good location”
Reviews.Author: g7nicholas
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very good value for money we were checked in rearly quick and offered a choice of rooms .The rooms were basic as you would expect for the money ,the rooms were cleaned daily and towels changed daily the beding was changed as you required you just put a card on the bed when you wanted them changed. The reception area was clean and tidy and staff freindly .The free continental breakfast was ok nothing special we only eat there once,we eat at the crakebarrel accros the road.very good food and good value.This hotel is ideal for disney resorts only 20minuts on the free shuttel bus taxis home only cost between $15 $23 depends on wich disney resort you get your taxi from animal kingdom is the closest.

Reviews.Title: “good for price paid, would gladly go back.”
Reviews.Author: jackblack81
