Reviews.Content: not a bad motel, and for the price it was worth every penny, take the cheaper motel and have more money to spend elsewhere, I'm planning on going back and staying at this motel very soon.......

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: mubsie
Reviews.Content: I have just come home from staying at the Continetal Plaza Hotel. I was quite worried after reading the reviews, but as we got a really good deal stoppping there for 2 weeks, we thought if it is that bad we could always find somewhere else, luckly it was fine and stopped there for 2 weeks. On arrival the hotel was really easy to find, marker 4 on highway 192, our sat nav brought up Quality inn westgate which is the hotels old name. The Receptionist was polite and helpful, as we had left some documents back in the uk, she gave us the full address of the hotel and when the documents arrived, she telephone our room to let us know. We stayed on the 3rd floor in room 323 which had a good view of the pool , lake and highway 192. The room was big with 2 double beds, tv, fridge & freezer, mircowave, iron & ironing board , hairdryer and a safe. The room wasnt the ritz and could have done with a lick of paint, but it wasnt as bad a what some people have said. The maid cleaned the room everyday and left fresh towels everyday if we reuqested them. We did however see two little ants on the dresser which i squashed but never saw any again. The beds were comfy and the aircon worked great. I think the smell people are saying is probably the same you get in your car when you switch it off for a bit. We never used the hotel for breakfast as there are so many cheap places to eat. We used the pool daily and found the pool to the be good and clean. Yes there were love bugs but you get them everywhere in florida. We never used the hotel shuttle bus as we hired a car. From previous experience from other hotels they usually only have limited pick ups for the parks. Overall we had a really good time and for the price we would stay here again. Any questions please ask.

Reviews.Title: “Okay, for its price!”
Reviews.Author: yessy08
Reviews.Content: The hotel was okay for the price. This is a place to stay for a long time but only to sleep and shower. The "Free" breakfast was only cereal, toast, coffee, and juice. By the way in the cereal there were ants. They do offer great deals on theme parks and car rentals. I loved that it did include: free parking, pool, laundry facility, free wireless, and free shuttle. I highly recommend Clearwater beach! The water is warm and the sand is very soft and white. There are dolphins swimming only few yards from the people but be careful because there are also sharks. One more thing, we asked for 1 king bed and got placed in a room with 2 twins. Didn't think is was worth the complain so just kept it that way!

Reviews.Title: “good value for money”
Reviews.Author: leamingtonblues
Reviews.Content: we stayed here in feb 2009 , take no notice of negative reviews , for wot you pay you cant grumble ,the rooms are big enough for my wife and 2 teenage girls , they were cleaned and beds were made every day, soap etc replaced daily . the hotel is on the main strip but once you close your door you dont hear any noise from traffic etc . this hotel is ideally located for disney as there is a road out of the back of the hotel which is a short cut to disney world , turn right out of rear of hotel , left at t junction 2 mins later you are on disney , right by animal kingdom . there are plenty of restaurants near the hotel such as sizzler and golden coral etc , but dont use the chinese next to hotel as we heard a few horror reports . you do get a free breakfast every morning but get there early if you want a seat as space is limited , the hotel has got a free shuttle to parks , but we had a car as this is much easier in florida . overall a great holiday and would return again , any questions regarding orlando and this area please email me and i will try and help i have been 4 times in 3 years and going back again real soon

Reviews.Title: “WHAT A DUMP”
Reviews.Author: trooper1999
Reviews.Content: This place needs a total refurb, the electrical plug sockets aren't fixed to the wall so plug in at your own risk, lasted only 3 nights(out of &) and had to move hotels, Our room 217 was dirty there was cobwebs on the ceiling and an iron mark in the floor, at first glance it didn't look too bad but look around and it's DIRTY. Breakfast is a free for all,only one toaster for all the guests, we had to take ours back to our room as never any where to sit.

Reviews.Title: “Charlotte's web”
Reviews.Author: RIDisneymama
Reviews.Content: Spider webs IN and OUT of the hotel room on 3rd floor. It was terrible, this place needs more maintanence or harder working staff members. Although it wasn't very well maintained, location was not bad at all. '

Reviews.Title: “Cheap fine for sleeping in”
Reviews.Author: aaawilson08
Reviews.Content: We didn't have a car so it worked with the shuttle to the parks (although it took a really long time!) the rooms are ok the service is ok the breakfast is ok. The location is really good, it is across the street from a supermarket restaurants and other useful things.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good price”
Reviews.Author: NielsB
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay here, we were here previously in the summer of 2006 (it was Quality Inn Maingate West back then). We booked our stay based on our previous experience. Our stay this time was pretty good again. The room was good, but on checking in it was obvious that someone had used the room after it was cleaned - some cookiecrumbs and an empty sodabottle were left behind. Not a big issue, but that shouldn't happen. We complained to the manager and were promptly offered another room. Since it was late at night and the other room was in a different part of the hotel we chose to stay. Apart from this initial hickup our stay was uneventful, the staff was friendly and helpful. The breakfast was decent - not as good as I've had at other hotels, but it was free so one shouldn't complain :) The location is awesome, about 15 minutes to Disney and almost within walking distance from some nice restaurants. There's a Walmart and a Target store about 20 minutes West from the hotel, some shopping arease (groceries, pharmacy etc) are closer by. On site there's a (small) pool, washing and drying facilities ($2 each, I believe), very cool. The one thing I was a bit 'meh' about; you have to pay for ice. Not much, but you have to bring a quarter to fill your ice-bucket, annoying if you don't know this and have to walk back to your room to find change. Other than the small annoyance with the room on checking in and the icemachine, I can wholeheartedly recommend this hotel. The price is right, and the location is super!

Reviews.Title: “simple trip of leisure”
Reviews.Author: vtankers
Reviews.Content: check in was fast & friendly,location is close to shopping,10 min from disney,15 min from universal & seaworld,1 hr from daytona & cape kennedy. hotel staff is fast,efficiant,& most of all friendly, i would not recommend this hotel to a friend,but i would recommend to all my friends thankyou Eugene V .

Reviews.Title: “big breakfast, good location, decent room. great value!”
Reviews.Author: cachecacher
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for a week June 7-14, and were extremely satisfied with the hotel. let me say that we've painstakingly read through all the reviews here and on expedia and hotels.com (note: there is another continental plaza hotel in orlando so be very careful not to read the wrong reviews!). we were aware of its potential shortcomings but decided to go for it because of the promotion -- we got the room for 205 USD for a week, tax and fees included. although there was supposed to be a 2 USD charge per room per night, payable at the end of the stay (i saw this at the time of checking in), it was never charged to my credit card. so, on to the reviews... its your average looking motel. reasonably clean both inside and outside. 5 minute drive up to animal kingdom, 25 minutes from airport. its got a pretty nice pool by the lake (supposedly heated, but we were there in june, so i could not verify this). the pool was well-maintained with clean pool chairs and tables, and pool towels offered free of charge from the concierge. room was decent too -- 2 double beds, tv, air conditioned (working really well), good lighting, ensuite shower and toilet (quite small though, so if you are a big guy, be careful!). a safe was also provided, which we found very useful. no closet, just a space for hanging 8-10 pieces of clothing. some reviews mentioned lotsa flies in the summer but we found it to be okay (maybe cos its only early june) but do bring an insect repellant. we brought one and sprayed our doors everyday! specific to our room... we got a room on the second floor, back facing the pool (and lake). the good thing is that the pool opens til 9pm so it might be a little noisy to get a room facing it. our room was about the 8th room away from the lobby, so we got free wireless internet (signal was 4 bars out of 5) inside our room, which helped us with our disney trip planning (we used ridemax, btw). if you get a room further from the lobby, you can still bring your laptop to the lobby and use the wireless internet. otherwise, there is one internet kiosk next to the concierge, which costs a quarter per minute. the beds were okay, but pillows are mediocre. bring your own if you are that fussy. breakfast... we found it to be really good (esp if you consider most motels at this price do not offer any). 6:30-9:30am. there was toast, juice (apple, orange), milk, cereals (frosties, corn flakes and frootloops), and the notorious waffle maker. the 2-minute waffle making process takes practice (you'll get it after one or two tries) but every now and then someone fumbles and cause unnecessary waiting for the rest of the line. expect to wait 5 mins for your turn to make a waffle, or more during "peak periods". our one week experience tells us that there are mainly two waves of breakfast crowds -- those aiming for taking the complimentary disney/universal studios shuttle will eat 30 mins before the shuttle (check with concierge for schedule that changes every month; we actually emailed them for a schedule before we left for orlando ocplazareservations@orlandocontinentalplazahotel.com), while those who drive to disney will eat around 9am. that means that if you hate waiting for the waffle maker or for a table to sit, you will need to get up early. we hit the peak period twice during our stay, and had to bring brkfast back to our room, which is okay since our room was sufficiently close. service... concierge was reasonably nice and helpful. i give it 4 out of 5, given my limited experience as i only checked in and out, and got pool towels. housekeeping was immaculate and deserving of a good tip. they tend to come around 930am (may vary depending on room location). i thought the maids were friendlier than the concierge. i did not use the onsite car rental, so i cannot comment. the car rental office is situated just behind the lobby. btw, parking is free, of course and plentiful. it gets real sunny and hot in the late morning so be sure to secure the shady spots (optimize with the trees, the motel building, and the sun!). amenities... limited within the compound. there was a gift shop where you can get disney merchandise and sun screen and stuff, but we did not patronize it. kissimmee is a great place for food though.. really. the entire 192 is like a tourist area with lotsa restaurants. we found TGIF to be top-notch. there was a small japanese place right across the 192 highway from the hotel with decent lunch set meals (it became a mainstay of ours after getting tired of disney hotdogs and its famous turkey leg). dont ever try the angels seafood buffet place along the 192. it says $19.99/$29.99 for seafood/lobster buffet, but when you get there, it becomes $26.99/$36.99. and the food selection and quality sucked. also, avoid cici's pizza buffet 2 mins drive away. pizzas are nothing but cheese with no meat, terrible selection of pasta and salad. it was cheap but trust me, i've never spent so little money and still felt cheated. we didn't try the china buffet right next to the hotel, but we saw bad reviews here and opted not to go. it was crowded from time to time though and we decided that we would try it only if the weather was bad enough which didnt happen. btw, there's a walgreens 5 mins walk from the hotel. get your water there. we got 24x500ml for $5. basically, would i stay here again? yes, definitely, cos the hotel was decent. i got my bed, tv, internet and airconditioning. the kissimmee area was great (of course, you need a car to enjoy this part).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent price”
Reviews.Author: Happycustomer24
Reviews.Content: We stayed in room 163, the room was very clean, my wife Santa enjoyed our stay very much. The Manager of the hotel gave us a good price so we decided to extend our stay from 1 night to 5, she was very helpful and polite, I think her name is Rocia, she showed us 3 rooms until we picked a room across the pool area, it was very convenient for our family. I told the manager,Rocia, that we will come back to stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Only stayed because it was free”
Reviews.Author: rayjaime
Reviews.Content: We were given this room for free during our visit to Orlando. All we had to do was listen to a timeshare presentation, down the street, in order to get the room... we just had to pay the taxes. I'm pretty sure they gave us this hotel so we can compare the 5 star accomadation to this dirty location. Wife and I were given a room with 2 double beds, next to some car rental office. Don't know where the rental cars were located?!?!? Our toilet never flushed properly and the washrooms were dirty. Very limited tv channels, but the room is only used for sleeping... you have to visit the Theme Parks when in Orlando. The only okay thing about the hotel was the location. 5 minutes to Disney. 20 minutes to Universal. One thing to get rid of... the desk where they offer coupons if you visit their timeshare location!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay and price!!!!”
Reviews.Author: likeToTravel63
Reviews.Content: The hotel is not very hard to find. The directions given by the hotel staff were very clear. Once we arrived, the staff was friendly and welcoming with a guest service stand willing to help. The person at the front desk met all are requests... a quiet room away from the traffic. The room was spotless, very very clean. The breakfast was ok. My kids loved the waffles though... And if you are planning on having breakfast, as a tip, come early!!! everybody likes to sleep in and come at once.... i understand this is not the hotel's fault. The transportation to the parks was a plus too, but there is only 2 trips to disney and 1 to universal and sea world, which is great if you dont have a car, but i recommend driving... there should be more... Also... there are plenty restaurants accross form the hotel to dine inn for a whole week....

Reviews.Title: “It was just "ok"”
Reviews.Author: megidath
Reviews.Content: Firstly we could not find the hotel, we needed to go a bit further down on the 192 than we were doing but when we finally got we got checked in very quickly, be warned the reception staff are very rude and unhelpful!! The room wasn't really that bad we were on the smoking floor (3rd floor) it was just very basic with a very small bathroom, there were always little ants around the sink area but no matter how many you washed away double the amount would come back. The maids would come everyday with lots of clean towels and make the beds. Aircon was a god send as it was so hot but you definately need earplugs for the night time as you will not be able to sleep with it on. They do a breakfast which does get very busy so all you need to do is take things up to your room, i think we managed to sit downstairs 3 times in 14 days. A car did get broken into when we were there so make sure you leave nothing on the seats. All in all i would stay there again but would request having a fridge as all of the rooms do not have them and the ice machine played up alot.

Reviews.Title: “OK for the money !!!”
Reviews.Author: Daisywooster
Reviews.Content: The holiday was our belated honeymoon, and I was dubious about staying here after reading the reviews. However the hotel was ok, for the money we paid we never expected the Ritz ! It is an ideal base, and lets face it how long are you at the hotel for. The guy on check-in was miserable, and on check-out we got clobbered for phone charges as our liberty phonecard we brought must not have registered properly, be careful !! All the reviews about the breakfast were true, however for seating get there early, the later you leave it you will not get a seat. The lady that cleaned our room was lovely and friendly, our room was always well made up and towels replenished, could not believe it when she said she had worked 23 days straight. We went at an ideal time, as we managed to get the free shuttles with no problems, however one time, we felt like we was on a theme park ride before we got there. Part of the back vent on the bus kept banging on my husbands head. We went to Discovery Cove, interacted with the dolphins and went snorkeling, it was amazing. However the pics package is expensive. We went on a time-share talk to get tickets cheaper for Magic Kingdom and Epcot, well worth saving the money for two hours of time. However do not get caught up, as we nearly said yes !. If you do not like big roller coasters i.e ones that spin and loop or have no children, Islands Of Adventure was a little dissapointing. The water rides kept us going, Popeyes barges was excellent until you see other people putting quarters in water guns to squirt you. Best parks for us was Epcot and Universal, the queue for soarin and test track in Epcot were worth it, to be honest they were the only real queues we had the whole two weeks, we were lucky ! Seaworld was very good, the shows were well worth seeing. Wal-mart is definately worth a trip, we got a notepad laptop and mp3 much cheaper than home, and as they are part of Asda, if anything goes wrong you can take it back there. We went to a flea market that had 250 booths according to the leaflet, but beware, hardly any were occupied. We both had tattoos done on our last day at Evolution Tattoos on International Drive, my husbands took 4 hours due to the detail, they did an amazing job. Due to the exchange rate, food did work out expensive. And a big beware, they add 17% tax on top of prices shown, not like back home when the price shown is what you pay. Cici's (eat as much as u like pizza, pasta, salad, pud) for $5.99 was good. And Golden China next to hotel (eat as much as u like chinese and pud) dinner for $12.97 was also very good. Dennys was our favorite. Prices for food in parks is expensive, and supermarket we found not really any cheaper than at home. A lot of places add gratuity on the bill already, although eat as much as u like and diners tend not to.

Reviews.Title: “The most ignorant and rudest reception clerk we have ever experienced”
Reviews.Author: Davlyn1234
Reviews.Content: Stayed 24-30/4/09 Reception clerk completely ignored my husband at check in and continued his paperwork right in front of him until he was finished some 5 minutes later. When my husband returned to the car I assumed he'd checked in due to the time he'd been gone but he hadn't as the reception clerk also wouldn't allow him to check in as the booking was in my name. My husband by this time was furious, so I went to check in while he calmed down, only to be pounced on by the resident sales lady selling attraction tickets. They're in no hurry to check you in but quick with the sales patter. Suffice to say she didn't get any of our business after our warm welcome! Maybe she should swap jobs with the reception clerk, I think they'd be better suited in each others roles especailly for us travellers! Normally things like this don't particularly bother us but after an 8hr flight and another hour drive from Sanford Airport, being met by an ignoramous like this was not what we expected. You have been warned! However, if you don't mind an ant infested room (no.154), filthy carpet, no coffee maker (standard in all hotels we've stayed in previously), no fridge, paying for the ice machine, facing a back road with no security wall, then this is for you. On the plus side, it's cheap (you get what you pay for), room was ok decorated if you overlook the fact that they missed out painting the back of the front door, rooms are cleaned every day and towels changed, the pool is heated and clean (even if tiny), it's very close to Disney and has an abundance of shops and eateries in walking distance with a chinese buffett across from the lobby. There is a free shuttle to disney (we had a car so didn't use this service). The breakfast is free and should be used if you're desparate as it is the same every day and very busy. There is toast, choice of cereal's, a waffle maker, coffee, tea, various juice's. Take my advice, get what you need and take it back to your room (use the tray that comes with the ice bucket). There is coffee available all day to take away but wait a while after breakfast as they don't fill it up. Oh, and if you're a tea drinker like me, tuff, they don't supply any or hot water to make your own during the day. Take some tea bags and a kettle!

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel was the worst ever”
Reviews.Author: SunburnAl
Reviews.Content: We had planned to stay for 6 days, however, we got robbed half an hour after check in. The manager on duty was unfriendly and didn't even offer help, until he finally called the police. After the sherrif arrived nobody even made it to our room to check on us or offer a different room. We left the next day after a nightmare night and overcrowded non eatable breakfast that you had to stay in line for half an hour. The rooms were stuffy and disgusting. I would never ever go back there again. Even though it was a deacent price, but below standard even for a cheap room.

Reviews.Title: “It was o.k.”
Reviews.Author: Forgottentraveler
Reviews.Content: Location was great. Close to parks...free shuttle to attractions but buses get full fast, they pick up at other hotels along the way. Might have to wait for second bus. Walking distance to many restaurants and shopping. Breakfast included but no place to sit. People sitting outside on sidewalk or bringing it to there rooms. Coffee was bad. Dunkin donut down the street is really good. Rooms were cleaned daily meaning beds made and fresh towels if wanted. Tiny bugs in the sink and on countertops, couldn't leave food lying around. Rooms need major updating.....old. No place to lounge. Pool was good. Payed half the price for two attractions and one water park for four people going to a timeshare ??? for two hours. Well worth it $$$.

Reviews.Title: “Basic but cheap”
Reviews.Author: joebloggs1987
Reviews.Content: Booked last minute through first choice websie as a lads holiday - £303pp B&B for 7 nights, flights from Manchester and Hire Car incl. Flights great - would quite happily fly long haul with First Choice/Thomson Airways again. Hire car and drive from Sanford - ok, but be aware this hotel has changed name and the directions given by First Choice still refer to the old name. It is now called the Continental Plaza Hotel. Hotel was basic, 2* - no more. Room was old and could do with a little refurb attention but kept clean with new linnen and towels daily. Room with 2 x double beds, shower over (tiny) bath, toilet, sink in room, hair dryer, TV, Iron and Board, sitting table and 2 x chairs. Reception staff were not the friendliest but did suggest having 3rd (top) floor room to prevent any noise from above. We had a room overlooking the pool which was heated (needed in Feb) and where free pool towels were provided (although if you want a beach towel take your own, the pool towels are tiny). Breakfast was VERY POOR, E Number ridden cereals, toast with limited jam and waffles (long wait) was about it - to top it all off there was no where near enough seating for everyone and we ended up eating standing up most days - would hate to stay here in high season. Location was good - on the 192, 5mins from Interstate 4 - 40mins sea world and universal, 1hr to Busch Gardens, 1hr 15 to Kennedy Space Center. Lots of restaurnt choices nearby. CAR NEEDED, although there is a free shuttle to some parks. Overall - ok for our needs but would not suggest this hotel for more than a 7 day stay, or for anyone with a family or who would want any level of service above 2* - and DEFINATELY WOULD NOT VISIT IN HIGH SEASON.

Reviews.Title: “Second stay here.. will come again”
Reviews.Author: Ed D
Reviews.Content: Located 2 miles from Interstate 4 and one mile from Disney entrances, the hotel is ideal for those going to Disney. We had other plans and traveled 2,000 miles all week. The hotel is still clean and neat. Ample parking and the rooms were promptly made up each day. The pool was clean and warm. Lots of souvenier and other shops really close by. Small dining area and ice machines as well as a small shop on the premises. Many, many restaurants in the area. Don't forget to go to "Old Town" about 5 miles down the road. A hidden treasure of small shops with amusement rides that I didn't even know about ( I only drove by it over a dozen times) and it's mostly free! Would most certainly stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “No Longer Quality Inn.. Now Called Continental Plaza Hotel! When We Arrived The Name Had Not Been Changed!!”
Reviews.Author: thisladylovesFlorida
Reviews.Content: Reception area TERRIBLE, STAFF not FRIENDLY, Breakfast is basic..Toast Waffals Cereals, Tables On a First come basis , room had Cockcroaches!! and dust behind units, NO kettle in room , NO fridge, bathrooms need facelift, NO ice in machines, washing machines not working properly! ! ( i was given a full refund) some of the staff don`t UNDERSTAND BASIC ENGLISH...change of towels every day by the WONDERFUL house maids who are always happy and smileley 10/10 for them, pool area lovely and supplied with clean towels, last of all the First Choice Rep a waist of time!! good luck to all who wish to stay here, i won`t be back thats for sure!!

Reviews.Title: “Cheap but that is about it!”
Reviews.Author: prez_8
Reviews.Content: Hi, Firstly paid very little for the flight and hotel (£460 per person for flight and 2 wks accom). so we were not expecting wonders, just needed a cheap getaway. But i must admit i would think twice before going back. Yes there was clean towels every day and clean bedding but our room was not hoovered and it was thick with dust near the skirting boards etc... the rooms only ever had a quick clean. Hairdryer didnt work, dead bolt on door nearly coming off. I must admit when i checked in i was expecting to want to move elsewhere the next day. But as that area has just so much to do we were that tired every night we just literally used the place as somewhere to sleep. I just thanked god we were on an action packed holiday and not stuck there!! The breakfast was basic, okay if you want a quick bit of cereal or toast but it did tend to get a bit chaotic and the 8 or so tables was just not enough to seat every one. We booked our theme( universal/disney) park tickets through the lady at the desk and this involved going to a timeshare presentation to a resort 10 minutes up the road. It was boring as we had no intention of buying a time share. And trust me they will give you the hard sell, but saved us nearly £300 on the on the door/travel agent prices. I must admit the travel agents in the UK try and scare you into buying tickets in the UK before you go but if you have time to do this it is worth it. Even on the door is the same price as agents if not cheaper. I would never but my tickets before i go. One of the most annoying things was the damn takeaway pizza leaflets under the door twice a day!!!! we used to stick our back out but they just stick more through. There was a notice in the lobby saying not to use the guys - maybe they should be more pro-active and stop them and their flyers coming onto the property! But if you do want good value Cici's pizza up the road was a top all you can eat pizza buffet with dessert for $5.99 and worth every cent!! In all this place is a cheap motel with a few hygiene issues if you can hack it it could provide you with a cheap holiday and more money to spend on the attractions. Would I go back? probably not - there was a lot of hotels on the 192 that looked just as good for $129 a week!

Reviews.Title: “Great value with great location”
Reviews.Author: joshore77
Reviews.Content: Just returned from an amazing two weeks in Florida, I have see lots of poor reviews about this hotel, but wanted to defend it at bit. Okay it's a bit tired and basic, but my god it is so cheap! The rooms are cleaned spotlessly every day, fresh towels and linen are replaced daily. The heated pool (important in January) is great spotlessly clean and really quiet. However the best bit of this hotel is by far the location, just 2 mile from Disney and surrounded by quality restaurants and shops, you can not go wrong. Yes I know there are fancier hotels in Florida, this was our third time and we have stayed in everything from a villa to a nice hotel on International drive. This was just as good as any of them. I guess as the saying goes you get what you pay for as we didn't pay much for the 4 of us we were pleased and surprised. We had a car whilst over there but the hotel did have a shuttle bus to the major parks for those that don't drive. We had the breakfast 1 day which was okay - but got really busy, we prefered to go out for breakfast to the Ponderosa which is just up the road. This place was a great base for a holiday where you spend most of your time out and about. Try it - it's basic (perhaps a 1 or 2 star at most) but it's great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Would never go back! Yuck!!”
Reviews.Author: vicki_dave
Reviews.Content: We arrived.. obviously very excited about disney! When we got to the hotel and checked in we initially had a bad feel about the place but hoped that it would get better once we settled in.. We were given our key and made our own way to the room.. It was distcusting! Very basic, the bathroom was tiny and dirty.. i didnt even want to step in the shower it was that bad, it smelt and was just yuck! The next morning we got up early and went to get breakfast.. it was set up in the LOBBY! with a couple of tables and chairs.. you had to fight to get a seat.. I wouldnt even call it a breakfast buffet.. there was toast or some skanky cereal or make your own waffle.. which tasted vile. On a better note... the hotel is in a good location and just down the road is a cafe thing where you can get an all you can eat buffet breakfast for very cheap, which served loads of fruit, cakes, a fry up, pretty much anything. Theres lots of restaurants very close.. a steak house, TGI fridays, outback, subway etc etc.. and a supermarket aswell which was handy. The hotel is only 5 mins away from the attrattions which was excellent. There are plenty of other hotels down the same stretch in an equally good/better location so my advice is to chose them and not stay at the quality inn!!

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: csk47
Reviews.Content: First off...for $36 a night it was ok. Had we paid the $76 a night rate if we stayed any more days, it would have been a monumental rip off. The good...the place was close to the main entrance to Disney and lots of food choices nearby to eat. The room was clean and had plenty of towels. Hummm. ..what else good? Guess that's it. The bad..the AC unit ran for one minute and shut off for three...all night long. The fan was set to high speed and couldn't be changed. The continental breakfast was a joke. Three types of cereal, toast and waffles to eat, milk, coffee and juice. No Danish, no fruit...nil, nada, nothing. The breakfast lines were out of sight. Worst "free" breakfast I have ever had. No in-room coffee makers, either. Also, they hit you up with some kind of $1.86 a night fee tacked onto your bill...surprise! The evening clerk was a little weak in communicating in English so I really didn't get an adequate explanation of the charge. There are many, many better choices for this area of Highway 192 near the Disney property. I won't be back.

Reviews.Title: “one of the better qualtiy inn's”
Reviews.Author: ianfld
Reviews.Content: just got back from 2 weeks at Qi, we just used it as a base to plan our disney wedding, we have stayed at the other 2 Qi's on I drive and this was by far the best, it had everthing you need around i.e dennys, walgreens etc, we could see animal kingdom from hotel so that give you idea of how close to disney, room was clean and cleaned daily, no problem with anyhting apart from what previous guests have said about limited seating for breakfast but no prob as we took it back to room!! Room had towels, pool towels (save on luggage!) free internet access, etc etc. if you want anymore information just E mail me!! P.s sanford airport hasnt got scales to weigh cases before you check in!! watch your weight guys, quite stricht on excess baggage $20 per kg...... cheers

Reviews.Title: “LOVED THE QUALITY”
Reviews.Author: tinks_woody
Reviews.Content: I have read some bad reviews of this hotel and do not agree we stayed here in october this year and would go back every year it was clean and had everything we wanted on site the staff were always helpful and room was always clean early in the day so if we went back for lunch it was alrewady done the hotel is in the perfect spot near disney and good easy place to get to the malls and shops i didnt find one bad thing about this hotel it was perfect

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here even if you are on a budget.”
Reviews.Author: tntraveler2448
Reviews.Content: What a dump! DIRTY! Take your own linens. We had to cut up one of the two towels we were given for the 3 nights we were there just to have washcloths.

Reviews.Title: “good value as previous stay”
Reviews.Author: timetravelers
Reviews.Content: 2nd Time Staying Here FANTASTIC VALUE Plus Added Bonus OF CONTINENTAL BREAKFAST STAFF Friendly ROOMS Reasonably Clean with Large TV Clean Sheets Safe IN Room Iron & Ironing Board Towels Changed Daily Heated pool with Towels Supplied free Washing Machines Dryers on site Free Ice Machines on all Floors Near Main Disney Area Perfect For All Areas Free TRANSPORT TO PARKS AND SHOPPING. This is a 2 STAR MOTEL Some Guests Expect All The Extras of a 4 STAR HOTEL If so Then do not STAY HERE This is perfect for the HARD DAY At the PARKS.WHAT MORE DO YOU WANT. HOPE THIS HELPS

Reviews.Title: “Good base for exploring”
Reviews.Author: Joey14roo
Reviews.Content: Stayed here a couple of years ago but felt the need to post as noticed a few bad reveiews and i didnt think it fair not to post the good reviews! I found this hotel a good base for exploring florida and all the parks. Great for couples that need a base, not so much for families that have early nights with the kids. We were out the door at 8am and back in at midnight for the whole 7 nights so this literally was a base, somewhere to sleep and refresh but i thought it was fine. Two double beds which were great because it was HOT so got a nice big bed to ourselves to keep cool (then a cuddle in the morning hehe) Good bathroom, good staff, good pool, TV with lots of channels and a free digital safe...... Good location on the 192 at the end so nice and quiet (with a mega short cut to animal kingdom if anyone wants to know it mail me) right near all the good buffet restaurants, close to disney and a short drive to universal. We had a thoroughly pleasant stay and definately got what we paid for. We booked with first choice and this seems to be there most budget hotel.............if you want better you'll have to pay for it i suppose, We wanted a cheap base to enjoy the local attractions but with that we also got a nice comfortable hotel room in a nice quiet area and everything was fineeeeeeeee. BUT personally i always stay clear of international drive as i find it quite run down and too busy............if you enjoy the 192 area of kissimee then this hotel is fine!

Reviews.Title: “great”
Reviews.Author: maxyLondon
Reviews.Content: We have just got back from staying at this hotel for 2 weeks. It was very clean and our room was ok. the staff were very freindly and the only bad report that we have is with the shuttle busses. We didn't want to drive so we relied on these and they took ages and were in a very bed condition. however this is not the hotels fault but Disney as they put on the transport. All in all a great budget place to stay

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money, close to the attractions 0 good if you have a car”
Reviews.Author: SaraLiz1
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great for a good value stay in Orlando when visting the theme parks. I would recommend it for anyone who has a hire car as it is quite close to all the major attractions by car but quite difficult to get around without a car. Breakfast, standard of rooms and pool were all far better than expected - I was very impressed. Don't take the free shuttle to Disney though as this is the first hotel on the pick up route and you'll spend an hour going round the other hotels picking people up only to drive past this hotel again on the way to Disney!

Reviews.Title: “not great”
Reviews.Author: scot1
Reviews.Content: we are just back from our stay here booked through first choice. I would not stay here again! We had a ground floor room on the opposite side from the pool, it smelled of damp and there was mold on the toilet wall. The beds & towels were clean & as we were only there for a week & hardly spending any time in the hotel then we just put up with it.(the rep was unable to come around til 3 days into the holiday anyway!) It was just kind of old/dated & grimy! I think the holiday company are really ripping folk of with what they charge if you get this hotel. Luckily we had a car so did not have to rely on shuttle buses. The hotel is actually in a good position on the 192 highway, really near to disney & close to lots of good places to eat - red lobster was the best it was just across the road. I would not recommend this hotel really - it is very basic, so is the breakfast

Reviews.Title: “fantastic time at the quality inn”
Reviews.Author: arielManchesterUk
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed at the Quality Inn, Maingate West for two weeks, and to be honest after seeing some of the previous reviews i was a little nervous thinking it would be a bit of a dump!, but after arriving i was very pleasantly surprised, the receptionist was polite and efficient and we were booked in very quickly and settled after our long flight. When we arrived at the room, i found it to be very clean with two double beds, a t.v with cable channels, a bath and shower in good working order and a large vanity sink with hairdryer and lots of space for all my toiletries and a dressing area with an iron and ironing board, of which i hadnt been expecting, also plenty of room for our luggage and clothes. We decided to have a look out and see what ammenities were around the hotel, as I thought we would be a bit out of the way from things, but it is excellently situated, Straight over the road from the hotel they have a T.G.I Fridays, of which is lovely and we spent quite a few nights there, it is also very reasonably priced and they are great with families and children, our daughter is 3, and she loved eating there, they had a balloon man come round every time making the kids balloon animals etc, also on the next block they had a similar restaurant called the Outback, which i also highly rated, the food was excellent and again very reasonably priced, also great with families and kids, also behind t.g.i's they have an off licence and supermarket, so if you like a drink its a good idea to stock up as drinks we found were very expensive over there, but cheap at the off licence, and also i would advise hiring a fridge for your room to keep the beers cold! also within a five minute walk on the same side of the road as the hotel they had a mc donalds, pizza hutburger king and a dennys restaurant, which is great if your on a budget, it was amazingly cheap!!, also the food was good and the service very friendly. There is also a chinease restaurant on the hotel grounds, but we didnt eat there. We decided not to drive over there on our trip as it was our first time, we were a bit worried about driving over there, and the insurance package offered to us by our operator was extortionate! over £300 for the two weeks!, and we werent informed of this until i phoned to check that the car offered to us in our package was insured as it hadnt been mentioned through the booking process, be careful not to be caught out with this one as if you have been offered a car with your package, and you get out there without insurance, it would be a bit of a shock as you would have to take out insurance over there before driving it away, and i would certainly be more expensive as well!!, anyway, we were using the shuttles provided by the hotel to take us to the theme parks, all i can say is they served a purpose, but took a lot of time out of your day, i dont want to complain too much about them as without them we would have been stuck, but all i can say is be prepared if you do take them as they were always between 10 and 25 minutes late, and take between an hour to an hour and a half to get you to your destination which is literally 10 minutes down the road by car, they would pick you up, and then go on to about 4 other hotels on the same side of the road as our hotel, then turn around and pick up at hotels on the other side of the road, half an hour later, you would go past the quality inn on the other side!!, coming back wasnt too bad, as you would be the second drop, so it took about 15 minutes to get back once the bus had turned up, again usually quite late. We learned a fewtricks to avoid being hassled with them to much, so i will pass these on to you!! The bus to take you to the magic Kingdom is at 8.10am, then you have the Universal and Seaworl one at 9.10am, then another disney one a 11.50am, which takes you to Epcot and Hollywood Studios, my advise wherever you are going within disneyland get the early bus to the magic kingdom!, once you get there, if you walk past the ticketing area from the bus depot, you will get to the polynesian hotel, which is a couple of minutes walk, from there, you just walk through the grounds of the polynesian, veer left and you come to the hotel bus depot, and the buses turn up literally every few minutes to go to all the other disney theme parks and water parks, it was great, if you do fancy a lie in, get on the later epcot bus, where you can get the monorail over to the magic kingdom, and then do the same if youwant to go somewhere else, we used it as a bit of a hub. Also if you want to leave early one night and dont want to wait for the shuttle, use disney transport to take you to the animal kingdom, as this is the closest disney park to the hotel, and get a taxi, ask him to take you down the sherbeth road shortcut, and it is $10 to get back, which is really cheap, its about $25 from any of the other parks. If you dont ask the taxi driver to take you down sherbeth road, hell take you down the highway which is an extra $5, i know it doesnt sound much, but when your money is running out youll appreciate it!!. The only other thing i was anoyed about with the shuttles is that they leave slightly to early to see the fireworks at the magic kingdom, so either risk the bus being late one night and watch them as we did, and because the bus was so late we still managed to get it, but obviously you cant rely on this, as now and again they are about on time, then make sure one night you just get a taxi as they are well worth staying to see, but unfortunately you would have to get a taxi from the magic kingdom, as the animal kingdom closes at 8pm. If we do go again i think we will definately save up the £300 pounds for the insurance and drive as the hotel is situated so close to all of the theme parks, all of which are fab!! and it is $11 dollars to park, and the roads all looked vry easy to drive on, very clearly signed and all pretty straight routes. we worked out we spent 52 hours on the buses, sad i know, but its quite a chunk of your holiday!! Back to the hotel, it also has a heated swimming pool which is great, dont get me wrong,the place isnt luxurious and if that is what your after it wont be for you, but it is a great base for a disney holiday, clean, friendly and has all the basics you need with lovely comfy beds and the rooms were cleaned and tidied daily and yes we did get clean towels in our rooms every day! I know ive had a few moans about the shuttles, but it didnt spoil our holiday, im just being honest as to what they were like and what to expect, i would use them again if i had to, it would just be a lot more convenient to drive but they get you there and back if you dont want to drive, also i noticed a lot of people had a moan about the breakfast area at the hotel as they said it does get very busy and there were not always enough tables for everyone,the breakfasts were good, they served toast with different spreads, 3 different cerials, juices teas and coffees and waffles, all of which filled us up plenty for the morning, if you want to avoid the table issue either get there very early or very late and youll be fine, failing that take it to your room!! anyway we would definately stay at this hotel again as we had a really fab holiday!! happy hols!!

Reviews.Title: “Good for price”
Reviews.Author: Greenwillow
Reviews.Content: I went to this hotel last year, and I thought it was a fantastic deal for the price! My boyfriend and I stayed there for 6 nights. The room was always cleaned, it was quite and we had no issues at all with our room. There is a pool but we never used it. We drove past the hotel the first time since it was hard to see the sign from the direction we came from. We stayed there because we wanted a cheap place to stay at while we explored Disney World. It is very close to the parks which was great. They do have a free breakfast but we only ate there once since we usually slept in too late, or we were just not hungry. Overall it was a great location for us and worth the price. We paid $38 a night for a double room.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: prybar
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel 3 times now over past 5 years I read the reviews on here before I went and was getting worried it was going down hill. I need not worried it was perfect, its not the most modern hotel on HY192 but it is very well priced. It is 2star but I found it fine they even offer a 100% satisfaction if they cant resolve any problems you don't pay. They have started to revamp the rooms but they have over 300 so it will take some time but I stayed in a older one. The door locks were all being upgraded as I was there. Pool was fine its salt water so no chlorine smells. The breakfast was ok but as mentioned a little crowed but I just used the tray in my room and took it back, or you can pay $5 outside at golden corral or cracker barrel both in walking distance. If you are on your way to this hotel don't worry its clean safe and the staff are very friendly. I had 3 problems in 2 weeks the safe was locked when I arrived (fault of last person to leave) I contacted reception a man was at my door 5 mins later and to fix problem, second problem was with safe no power (my fault caught switch inside and turned it off) again fixed in 5 mins, the third was the light in bathroom blew again one phone call fixed in 5 mins what more can I say. If i was being really picky there was a crack in the bath that had been repaired but you cant expect them to rip out the whole bath for a small crack. please use this hotel it really is fine. i give it 10 out of 10

Reviews.Title: “Dont Be Put Off By The Few Bad Reviews.”
Reviews.Author: sOUPkING
Reviews.Content: Dont Be Put Off By The Few Bad Reviews. I booked this for my wife, daughter and I on a well priced package without really checking the hotel specifically before hand. Reading some of the reviews afterwards I spent a few days getting a bail-out plan in place - I wasted my time. Honestly I just don't know what some people see to complain about with this place, sure it's no 5 star establishment but you knew that when booking at $40 a night right? Trust me if it was dirty, covered in spiders, falling apart etc we would have been out of there without unpacking. The room was fine, clean, decent beds, new and clean bedding every day if you so choose, loads of towels in room and at poolside again changed daily. TV with 20 odd channels incl Sport and Disney channels. Shower room ok, not pristeen but not filthy by any stretch of the imagination. Free safe, pool nice and decent view of the lake and the lights on 192 if you get a front facing room. Sure the corners could be swept a little better and the silicone around some tiles could be freshened up but don't stress about it. We really could not complain about the value for money at this place and had a great time. My daughter saw the rewiew relating to spiders below before we travelled and obviously remembered. On the last day she said to me "Dad the only spiders I've seen here were at the theme parks inside glass tanks"

Reviews.Title: “Great location, bad hotel”
Reviews.Author: kimtinsy
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located near Disney World (20 min. drive, w/ slight traffic) and W Irlo Bronson Highway (192), where there must be 100s of restaurants and attractions you can go to on that highway. A car will definitely be handy. The hotel provides scheduled shuttle service to and from the major theme parks but the schedule is the problem, it leaves you little time to enjoy the sights and you probably won't finish any theme park if you were to follow the shuttle's sked. The room was very basic, plain, old and worn. There were molds on the toilet. Complimentary breakfast was mediocre, I'd rather go to some nearby restaurant's breakfast buffets for $4++/person. You get what you pay for, and it was cheap but that's just about it. Just use this hotel as a base for the theme parks, save your money too and buy discounted theme park tickets from Wal-Mart. I couldn't trust some of the ticket sellers as they usually advertise that they buy "unused tickets", too risky in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Motel”
Reviews.Author: FLfishR
Reviews.Content: Nice older motel, Quiet, clean. All you could ask for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great price, great location”
Reviews.Author: juliaplynn
Reviews.Content: This motel is ideal for a budget stay in Florida. It's about 10 mins from Hollywood Studios and Epcot, about 20 mins from the other main theme parks. As others have said, the rooms are a bit outdated. Think 1970s Travelodge. They could do with a good steam clean and a good vac, but overall are cleaner than the 5 star WDW Dolphin I stayed in, in 2006! We booked through Hayes and Jarvis and paid about £20 a night including breakfast. If you like to breakfast like a king, the "continental breakfast" may not be for you. Coffee, tea, juice, toast, waffle mixture, cereals, and a very cramped room to consume it in. Better still go to Sizzler about 500m away, all you can eat for $4. The rooms have shampoo, conditioner, body lotion, soap, tea, coffee, sugar (all replaced daily), coffee maker (not great but it works), ice bucket (fill from machines on each floor) and a digital safe. There are lots of face flannels and towels (mainly white and fluffy with the odd exception) but they are VERY small. Linen is changed as often as you like (leave a little sign on the bed), and towels are replaced every day. The beds are VERY comfortable. The pool is clean, if basic, and not used by many guests so often empty. There is a shop selling lots of useful bits and pieces (and lots of tat!). Tip: don't give your mail to the guy in the shop - he charges an extra 40c per postcard, and I'm not feeling that confident that the cards will ever arrive ... There are drinks machines on every floor (no water though, spookily) and there is a washing machine and some driers. There is also a large TV with numerous channels. There is a Chinese restaurant in the car park but we didn't try it. Our favourite restaurants in the vicinity were Red Lobster and IHOP. Due to its proximity to the 192, there is road noise, but it isn't that bad and after long days in theme parks, we just didn't let it bother us. Head hit pillow ... sleep ! Overall, this is a bit of a case of "you get what you pay for" but after dreadful experience at the Dolphin, I would definitely return here due to its many advantages.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible, Horrible Service”
Reviews.Author: zumizoomzoom
Reviews.Content: his hotel was had very disappointing customer service and staff. First, the shuttle service they offered took us to the wrong theme park 40 minutes late without any explanation. The 9:00 PM shuttle did not show up so we waited till 10:40 for the 10:30 bus to show up. We asked to meet with the manager by appointment about it and asked for her the following day. The front desk refused to let us see her stating that the shuttle is not the manager's responsibility. We met with the manager (Rocio) to discuss this bus situation but it did not solve anything. Instead of listening to what we had to say, she continually interuppted us mid-sentence and told us we were wrong. My friend who stayed at the hotel with me got angry and started to raise her voice. The manager did the same. I have never met a manager who actually YELLED at a customer till i met her. She told us she didn't believe us because we were the only people who have complained about this situation. But that was because either the other families were foreigners and didn't know how to voice their complaints. The hotel room itsself was okay for it's price. We did have however, ants around the sink that kept on popping out. My main point is: The manager is absolutely rude and holds no responsibility in her job. That itself, just ruined my whole hotel experience at Quality Inn Maingate West.

Reviews.Title: “Great price..... Great room!!”
Reviews.Author: jennababy24
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 2 weeks. We were on a budget so this place was perfect for the price. The hotel itself was great!! It was cleaned everyday, the safe was free (bonus) and the beds were the most comfortablist (?) beds I've ever slept in in a hotel. We never went for the free breakfast as there was never a table free but there's a Ponderosa just down the road. It's not the best location as you do need to drive everywhere but that was all part of the fun for us!! In saying that, just across the road you have TGI Fridays, Subway, supermarkets, mini golf and a few other shops. Overall it was a great base for a fun packed holiday!!!

Reviews.Title: “Is Fine for the price”
Reviews.Author: Jurnee
Reviews.Content: I needed a place to stay for 3 nights before I could get into my villa rental and at a total price of $123 this suited me very well. Being situated right off Hwy 192 makes this location extremely central. I was in Disney World in less than 10 minutes. The rooms are your basic hotel rooms - no fancy flat screen TV or dozens of channels - but it's clean and you have an elevator so you don't have to carry your luggage up the stairs. The pool didn't look terribly promising and isn't very private, so I didn't use it. I never made it to breakfast on time so can't comment on that. This hotel was fine for a short while but I would not have wanted to spend my entire 10 day holiday here.

Reviews.Title: “watch out for "free local calls"”
Reviews.Author: hoseface
Reviews.Content: the room was ok for the money as was the property. the continental breakfast was ok also. a sign in room states free local calls. this was not true as you needed to dial the area code just to make a local call. over $12.00 was added to our room bill due to the "free local calls".

Reviews.Title: “quality price”
Reviews.Author: tomthecat
Reviews.Content: we stayed at this hotel for 19 nights over the xmas/new year period. it was an incredible price, only £12 per room per night including breakfast. the only problem with breakfast was that at whatever time you went (opens 6.30-9.30am i think!) there were never any free tables. apart from that , the breakfast was adequate and you can have as much as you wanted. the room was large with tv, coffee making facilities, shampoo etc. it was cleaned daily with fresh towels, soaps etc. and you put a little sign on your bed whenever you required clean sheets. our room didn't over look the pool (which is on the same side as the main road) so we had no traffic noise off the busy 192 road. the bathroom was spotless with plenty of hot water at all times. it is literally a 5 min drive to disney,& I-drive isn't too far away. we could see the mount everest ride from our room. there is a chinese buffet next door, TGI Friday's is just across the road as is a large supermarket, subway, a liquoir store and quite a few other shops & restaurants. within a couple of mins drive you have all the outlets, camera shops,denimworld, ponderosa and many other eating places. there are also a couple of crazy golf courses within walking distance. the reception staff were very helpful and our maid did a fantastic cleaning job in our room (which was always in a mess!) trhere is a safe in the room which you programme your own code into and it's free to use. overall it is a great hotel, good location and fantastic price. we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Get some waffles down ya”
Reviews.Author: Mick28
Reviews.Content: When we first arrived, our first impression was, great and when we got into the room it was even better as we had a fridge, microwave & Tea & Coffee facilities (We did how ever pay extra for this pleasure of about £1 a day.) The bonus was that there was a FREE digital safe which is a must any where to travel. Disregard all the negative reviews as you will always get moaning *************. The breakfast was better than other free breakfasts served at other motel like hotels in florida. Eat as many waffles as you can. Remember the sypup is quite fattening but look out for the basket which has low fat/sugar syrups. The staff are friendly as well. If your phone charger does not work (like mine) go to the reception and say that you left your charger the last time you stayed any they will be more than happy to take you to a room full to the roof of 2 pin phone chargers, it may take you hrs. free ice is available from the corridor and laundry is available. The pool is nice and quiet and free towels. The pool over looks the lake. (watch for the aligators kids) Happy Holidays

Reviews.Title: “its all an opinion !!!”
Reviews.Author: glassmen007
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel for five nights in December-15th-19th.. Arriving on the Sat afternoon I expected to have to wait to check in but even with a small que in fron of me the young lady at the desk proved extremelly effecient and within 20 mins-I had a downstairs room and we had unpacked and were heading back out for some cheap trainers. The room was fine-and was well serviced each day by the maids-some parts of the hotel look worn but its an older hotel so what do you expect ?.. I heard no noise-the wife loved the pool and in all the hotel proved more than adequate.. I guess times of visit to hotels will impact on them eg school holidays the Summer etc-all I know is that when you travel the start of December you dont get much hassle and the hotels always seem to be better !!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for the price!”
Reviews.Author: Natalie6282
Reviews.Content: I travelled over from England with my husband and 2 young boys and we stayed in the Quality Inn Maingate West from 5th Nov-2nd Dec 2007. The hotel is quite far down the 192 but a great location for Disney and picking up the I4. The rooms were basic but had everything we needed to rest after a long day at the parks and the cleaners came in every day and did a great job. The free breakfast is ideal to fill up before a busy day, although the room is really small (it's in the hotel lobby) and can't always get a seat straight away. The pool was lovely and clean although it was being refurbished during the 1st week of our stay so was unavailable but an alternative pool was provided at the Clarion Hotel down the road. The only negative thing I can say, is it hasn't got a bar which is a shame. Overall, I think this hotel is great for the price (far better than I expected after some of the reviews you read) and I would definately recommend this hotel and stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “No suprise, meet my needs”
Reviews.Author: Birdnowhere
Reviews.Content: Stay there for 5 nights, convenient location to Disney and airports (next to hwy4). It is clean with no suprise, hot water runs fine. It provides the basic with good price (cheapest if book through hotels.com). The AC is noisy , better bring your own ear plugs. The free shuttle leaves at 7: 30 to Disney even though the park open at 9. We end up driving to Disney and pay the $11 parking fee for the freedom. The Chinese restaurant (Golden China) next to it is not so good. We find a much better Chinese buffet by driving west 192 for 2 miles from the hotel. Its name is ACE plus (next to Howard Johnson) with good price ($11 adult). No time to use the pool of the hotel for we stay at Disney almost all day long.

Reviews.Title: “nice room, property lousy”
Reviews.Author: mgoblue325
Reviews.Content: The room was very nice,roomy and clean. The property though was not nice at all. Landscaping was terrible,elevators were dirty and anywhere outside of the room was not well maintained. Luckily we only stayed one night. I would highly suggest spending more money to stay at a Disney property or a more expensive hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for the Price!”
Reviews.Author: softiegal
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in December 2006. We thought it would be pretty bad for the price we paid, but we were very surprised as to how much we like this hotel. It was basic, but good. We were supposed to stay for 6 nights, but extended our stay to 9 nights. Pros: - The room was spacy & clean - The pool was warm and fun to swim in - Friendly staff - Good location (next to some great shops!) - Cool birds (i think they were cranes) came to visit outside the hotel rooms every day! Cons: - Breakfast was very basic and sometimes it was hard to get a seat. We will be staying in this hotel again the next time we travel to Orlando!

Reviews.Title: “More than pleased !!!”
Reviews.Author: lovelaughtravel
Reviews.Content: When we arrived, although the front desk staff could not find our reservation, I showed them my confirmation sheet and they fixed everything. The very kind and helpful Dario, who was at the the front desk that afternoon, honored all my requirements and we were more than happy with the room assigned. The pool was warm and clean. The breakfast was good, more than most free continentals. The housekeeping couldn't have been more helpful . My kids just couldn't wait to see how their stuffed animals would be tucked in by the staff . For the price we paid, what more could you ask for? We are planning to stay there again for sure and we can only highly recommand the Quality Inn Maingate West !!!

Reviews.Title: “Extremely satisfied.”
Reviews.Author: KEN 96
Reviews.Content: I have just been reviewing some of the comments by some of your members, and feel that I should add my wife's & my own remarks. Last minute booking in June through First Choice Holidays from England allocated this Hotel to us. For the price we paid for the Package (including Star Class Air travel & also a Hire car) we were pleasantly surprised at the quality afforded us here both the accommodation and definately the attention of ALL OF THE STAFF. Excellent !!!! On that occasion we stayed for 2 weeks. WE INTEND TO RETURN THERE AGAIN IN THE NEAR FUTURE.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: darling15
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a weeks holiday staying at the Quality Inn. We were worried after reading the reviews. When we arrived I immediately went to look at the rooms,the rooms were clean and we had clean sheets and towels daily. As we had two double rooms for four of us there was plenty of room. My children (18, 15) were in the room next door and as there was a door inbetween the rooms we unlocked this and made it much easier to go to each others room. The air con. was superb and not noisy. We had breakfast every morning and although basic it was ok. We booked our Universal Studio tickets here and got a very good deal. The location couldn't be better and there are lots of restaurants around the hotel. It was very quiet at night and we all slept peacefully on the comfortable beds. We got a great last minute deal with First Choice and to be honest we were expecting the worst but we were happy with everything. We normally go on 5 star cruises and we are all fussy and expect our moneys worth. Well we got a 2plus hotel and were satisfied. We left early to get to the parks and arrived back late after shopping at the outlets, so it did us for a week. We never used the pool as there were only a few sun parasols and it was just too hot to be in the full sun. Everyone at the hotel was pleasant and helpful. All in all its a basic clean hotel in a good location to all parks and restaurants. We would have struggled without the hire car so I would advise you to get one! We would stay here again, if you want more luxury it is not for you, if you want a clean safe place and conveniently located for parks then its perfect! The money we saved bought us lots of super things from the Malls and Outlets. If you do go here dont forget the free newspaper in the reception every morning.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Does not Honor requests & Breakfast not good”
Reviews.Author: Keystone_Cruiser
Reviews.Content: We booked four rooms at this hotel as a "gathering" point for our group before we checked into Disney the next day. Basically a hotel close to Disney that we could stay at for one night, Three of us arrived about 3:00 p.m.. We had requested a handicapped room for my parents, first floor rooms for all of us and close together if not adjoining. Only the handicapped request came through. I made my initial reservations for all four rooms back in March and got a good rate through Choice Hotels.com. Then when I was reviewing the hotel in early May, I happend to recheck the rates on Choicehotels.com and found that the rates being offered at that time were lower than my March rates. I cancelled the March reservations and made new reservations at the cheaper rate. (which was the rate we paid.) Three of the rooms groups arrived together around 3:00 p.m.. At that time, my parents were assigned a first floor handicapped room, my family was placed a whole building away on the second floor and the third group was three doors down from us in the second building. I asked where the fourth room was going to be, and was told 244 (two doors from one of our group.) In defense of the hotel, the hanidcapped rooms are all together on the first floor of the first building and so we could not be on that floor near them. (Understandable.) Our group went to dinner around 5:00 p.m. and the fourth room group showed up. I had already talked to them on the cell phone and had told them the room number that they would have and where it was in relation to us. When they did check in about 6:00 p.m., they were told that 244 was no longer available and the only rooms the hotel had left were on the third floor. I'm not sure why the hotel would give out a room that was already assigned, especially after telling others that room number! I also don't understand why our group could not be on the second floor of the first building above my parents. I helped my parents put their luggage in their room when we checked in and then walked to my room by going up the stairs in the first wing and down, passing the rooms above my parents... unassigned rooms have the drapes open and you can see in. Most of the rooms in the first building appeared to be unassigned when I walked down the walkway at 3:30 p.m.! If they were going to switch our other group from their assigned room, then why was it any different for these rooms? The hotel simply wouldn't honor requests, so don't waste your time making them. The pool was very nice and the kids had a great time. The room was clean altough the bathrooms could use some upgrades. The location is very good. Finally, the breakfast. I have been to alot of hotel breakfasts and this one rates near the bottom. They had waffle makers, bread for toaster, muffins, bagels, very limited cereal choices and beverages. No fruit at all. The toaster was a rolling one and would only toast one side of the bread. The biggest problem with the breakfast was all of the "outsiders" who were eating there. There were several construction workers (appeared to be from a road crew) in the breakfast area. They monoploized the waffle makers, they took 7-8 slices of bread and toasted them and just basically pigged out. I don't have a problem with the hotel giving the work crews free coffee BUT when they wipe out the food supply and monopolize the cooking devices so that the PAYING customers have to wait and are shut out of some items, it is not fair. This hotel is ok for a one night stay, but I couldn't imagine putting up with this for a whole week! This is the first really negative review I have had to write about a Quality or Comfort Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Good Price..Great Location”
Reviews.Author: jlw1973fl
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel after reading the reviews through the Choice Hotels web site. The location is great lots of resturants, stores, pharmacy and supermarket near by. The staff was very helpful and friendly. The breakfast was good and more then most free continental. Our room was clean and although older comfortable. We arrived very late approximately 1:00 AM and the cleark was alert, friendly and expecting us we were checked in and on our way to the room in about 5 minutes. We are planning to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at all costs!”
Reviews.Author: ElliSonn
Reviews.Content: We booked 2 rooms for a week at the quality Inn for July this year. When we arrived we were told that only 1 room had been booked and that there was no way we could get a second although we had the confirmation clearly stating the correct dates and had already paid. The guy on the front desk was very rude and point blank refused to find us another room therefore I had to drive around with 3 young children at 10 PM looking for a hotel room while my partner stayed and demanded to see a manager. When I returned they had miracuously found us another room. Great! until we went into the room. The carpet was soaked wet and there was a terrible damp smell in the room. This was not an isolated case as my sister-in-law was on the other side of the hotel and her room also had a bad smell. After 1 night we could not stand the damp smell and checked out to find another hotel. The day time front desk staff were a lot friendlier than the young man the previous night. It is in a good location but there is no security and it is definitely the worst hotel I have stayed in out of the 12 hotels I have visited in Kissimmee. If you have booked I would recommend you cancel and book at the Radison Parkway or book a villa at Emerald Isle.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location & a bargain”
Reviews.Author: B250282
Reviews.Content: My partner & I stayed here the first two weeks in May 2007 & after reading some reviews here I admit that I feared the worst......but upon arrival I was happy to see that most of it was over exaggerated. The hotel is situated literally a stone throw from the disney resort and our room was facing the animal kingdom & we could watch the fireworks from our door. The hotel is basic. The beds are VERY comfy and rooms are cleaned daily!! The stuff you may have read about the flies is partly true but I think it's the time of year plus it's not as bad as it's made out to be. Breakfast is complementary and consists of waffles, cereal, tea, coffee, toast etc. A good place to fuel up for the long days at the parks. There is also free shuttle buses to the parks but can get full as they pick up from several places. There are countless places to eat around the hotel & there's an all you can eat chinese buffet next door that's good. In short don't expect a flash, fancy place but do expect somewhere cosy to get your head down at night that's clean and friendly. How much time will you be in the hotel anyway??? We were hardly there as there's too much to do!!!! I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad place for the money”
Reviews.Author: GBTV
Reviews.Content: With AAA, I payed $55 a night which is a deal around there. I typically stay at Hampton Inn but we were trying to do this on the cheap. The hotel is about 10 minutes from Disney and 20 from Universal or Sea World. There are numerous restaurants around including a Dunkin Donuts. The facility looks fine, has an elevator and a decent size pool. Everyone there is visiting Disney. We stayed in room 237 I believe. There were two beds and a kitchenette. The rom is older but fine. I checked for bugs including bed bugs. I'm a tv new reporter and did a piece on how to find bed bugs. I did not find any in the room. Here are some tips to find them. Lift the head board off the wall and look behind it. They come off very easy and the bugs are easy to see. Also, look inside pillow cases and pull sheets up quickly and look for anything running. there's a product called [--]. this stuff kills bed bugs and leaves a nice cinnamon smell. Anyway, no bugs, room was clean, plenty of towels, air worked fine. Do NOT count on breakfast. It was very crowded and they basically had toast and cereal. We grabbed donuts. Tip on Disney. Water tastes like sulfur or burnt hair. yuck. Ask for cups of water from concession stands or to fill a water bottle. every park, disney or not, will do this for free and water tastes MUCH better. we also brought food in a small cooler bag and saved a lot of money. Have a great time and don't worry about staying here.

Reviews.Title: “What's the fuss about”
Reviews.Author: LiverpoolJamesy
Reviews.Content: Booked through First Choice and after reading some of the reviews I was fearing the worst, but on arrival I was pleasantly suprised. Check in was a breeze. Room was on 3rd floor at the back of hotel with a view of the Disney fireworks each evening. All staff (maids, grounds and desk) were cheery and polite. Grounds and pool were kept clean. Room was clean and fresh smelling. Linen changed almost daily. Towels, shampoo, soaps etc... replenished daily. Given a room with a fridge and microwave (had not booked, nor was I charged for). Free breakfast - granted area was small but then there is a 3 hour window i.e. 6.30 - 9.30. Free shuttle to parks. Shuttle to LBV outlets. This hotel is great for a base, which is all you need whilst in Orlando. The location is superb - close to restaurants, supermarkets and Disney. In my opinion the hotel across the lake (Best Western Lakeside), which rates 18th, is no better than this hotel. O.K. it may have larger grounds and more pools, but the rooms are exactly the same. I know this because I have stayed there in Aug 2001. In fact they still have the same bedcovers and carpets going by the photos that have been submitted. All in all, most of the hotels/motels are much the same unless you are staying on Disney property, but then again you are paying for the name. Save your money, stay basic and give yourself more spending money for all those shopping malls.

Reviews.Title: “Bargain”
Reviews.Author: CHOPPERCAM
Reviews.Content: I looked at several hotels in the area that were budget priced. I read reviews of many of them before choosing this hotel. I got what I expected for the price and have no complaints with the room. The room was clean, linens fresh and the air conditioning worked fine. The breakfast area was probably slightly small consdering the number of people staying at the hotel. Service was promptly cut off at 10 AM although several guests were still trying to eat. Not a big deal, but a little more compassion might have been shown given the amount of guests. My biggest complaint was the lack of internet service. Service is only available in one of the three buildings. It meant you needed to sit in the lobby/dining area for wireless service. But overall, you are not paying for the Ritz. The staff was great, the cost reasonable, you could do worse.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and Nasty”
Reviews.Author: nickwales
Reviews.Content: THE GOOD....Fast Check-in,Close to Disney, Free pool towels, Clean, safe pool, Easy walking distance to restraunts, Free basic breakfast THE BAD....Air-con was loud and slow, paper thin walls, not enough cupboard space, poor decor, small bathroom, no porter, Unreliable and not enough park transfers, Bad smells in room. THE UGLY....Unsafe exposed electrical wiring, Loud drunken kids on both weekends, No sercurity. Located on a loud busy road frequantly used by the local fire departmentand large lorries, Constant pestering from the ticket stand to sell you a timeshare and tickets. THE VERDICT...Very basic..This hotel needs to be knocked down and rebuilt...if your looking for a low cost quality hotel dont stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay here at the maingate”
Reviews.Author: sophieperreault
Reviews.Content: After terrible reviews i was afraid to walk in . I inspected every pillow , every matress , and the bathroom RIGHT away , they were all clear of ANY unwanted guests. The room was humid , so it had a musky clean scent , lol , hard to decribe. Beds were VERY comfortable , so were the pillows. Front desk polite , but not eager to help. Guest services, at the other desk , were VERY helpful in planning our trip and WDW visits. This hotel is far from florida mall , with no shuttle service there . Oceola mall is a 30 minute bus ride , but NOT worth going. VERY cheap mall , we walked in and walked out right away. 30$ cab ride to florida mall. there are FREE shuttle rides to the outlets which are very fun to visit. Free shuttle rides to ALL theme parks. Free breakfast - waffles , cereal , good muffins , tea coffee , juices. We got a number from a shuttle driver for his private transportaion company for a 40$ only ride to the airport , instead of the regular 52$ ride with the time meter. email me if you would like the number. The pool is GREAT open from 10am to 10pm , very good after a long day at the parks , and its HEATED at night! And slightly heated in the day , they keep it refreshing. supermarket across the street , to fill up your hotel fridge with fruit and drinks.
